107struct vfsops zfs_vfsops = {
108 .vfs_mount = zfs_mount,
109 .vfs_unmount = zfs_umount,
110 .vfs_root = zfs_root,
111 .vfs_statfs = zfs_statfs,
112 .vfs_vget = zfs_vget,
113 .vfs_sync = zfs_sync,
114 .vfs_checkexp = zfs_checkexp,
115 .vfs_fhtovp = zfs_fhtovp,
116};
117
118VFS_SET(zfs_vfsops, zfs, VFCF_JAIL | VFCF_DELEGADMIN);

156 &zfs_vnodeop_opv_desc,
157 &zfs_specop_opv_desc,

159 &zfs_sfsop_opv_desc,
160 NULL,

163struct vfsops zfs_vfsops = {
164 .vfs_name = MOUNT_ZFS,
165 .vfs_min_mount_data = sizeof(struct zfs_args),
166 .vfs_opv_descs = zfs_vnodeop_descs,
167 .vfs_mount = zfs_mount,
168 .vfs_unmount = zfs_umount,
169 .vfs_root = zfs_netbsd_root,
170 .vfs_statvfs = zfs_statvfs,
171 .vfs_sync = zfs_netbsd_sync,
172 .vfs_vget = zfs_vget,
173 .vfs_loadvnode = zfs_loadvnode,
174 .vfs_newvnode = zfs_newvnode,
175 .vfs_init = zfs_init,
176 .vfs_done = zfs_fini,
177 .vfs_start = (void *)nullop,
178 .vfs_renamelock_enter = genfs_renamelock_enter,
179 .vfs_renamelock_exit = genfs_renamelock_exit,
180 .vfs_reinit = (void *)nullop,
181 .vfs_vptofh = zfs_netbsd_vptofh,
182 .vfs_fhtovp = zfs_netbsd_fhtovp,
183 .vfs_quotactl = (void *)eopnotsupp,
184 .vfs_extattrctl = (void *)eopnotsupp,
185 .vfs_suspendctl = genfs_suspendctl,
186 .vfs_snapshot = (void *)eopnotsupp,
187 .vfs_fsync = (void *)eopnotsupp,
188};
189
190static bool
191zfs_sync_selector(void *cl, struct vnode *vp)
192{
193 znode_t *zp;
194
195 /*
196 * Skip the vnode/inode if inaccessible, is control node or if the
197 * atime is clean.
198 */
199 if (zfsctl_is_node(vp))
200 return false;
201 zp = VTOZ(vp);
202 return zp != NULL && vp->v_type != VNON && zp->z_atime_dirty != 0
203 && !zp->z_unlinked;
204}
205
206static int
207zfs_netbsd_sync(vfs_t *vfsp, int waitfor, cred_t *cr)
208{
209 struct vnode_iterator *marker;
210 zfsvfs_t *zfsvfs = vfsp->vfs_data;
211 vnode_t *vp;
212
213 /*
214 * On NetBSD, we need to push out atime updates. Solaris does
215 * this during VOP_INACTIVE, but that does not work well with the
216 * BSD VFS, so we do it in batch here.
217 */
218 vfs_vnode_iterator_init(vfsp, &marker);
219 while ((vp = vfs_vnode_iterator_next(marker, zfs_sync_selector, NULL)))
220 {
221 znode_t *zp;
222 dmu_buf_t *dbp;
223 dmu_tx_t *tx;
224 int error;
225
226 error = vn_lock(vp, LK_EXCLUSIVE);
227 if (error) {
228 VN_RELE(vp);
229 continue;
230 }
231 ZFS_ENTER(zfsvfs);
232 zp = VTOZ(vp);
233 tx = dmu_tx_create(zfsvfs->z_os);
234 dmu_tx_hold_sa(tx, zp->z_sa_hdl, B_FALSE);
235 zfs_sa_upgrade_txholds(tx, zp);
236 error = dmu_tx_assign(tx, TXG_WAIT);
237 if (error) {
238 dmu_tx_abort(tx);
239 } else {
240 (void) sa_update(zp->z_sa_hdl, SA_ZPL_ATIME(zfsvfs),
241 (void *)&zp->z_atime, sizeof (zp->z_atime), tx);
242 zp->z_atime_dirty = 0;
243 dmu_tx_commit(tx);
244 }
245 ZFS_EXIT(zfsvfs);
246 vput(vp);
247 }
248 vfs_vnode_iterator_destroy(marker);
249
250 /*
251 * Then do the regular ZFS stuff.
252 */
253 return zfs_sync(vfsp, waitfor);
254}
255
256static int
257zfs_netbsd_root(vfs_t *vfsp, vnode_t **vpp)
258{
259
260 return zfs_root(vfsp, LK_EXCLUSIVE | LK_RETRY, vpp);
261}
262
263static int
264zfs_netbsd_vptofh(vnode_t *vp, fid_t *fidp, size_t *fh_size)
265{
266 znode_t *zp;
267 zfsvfs_t *zfsvfs;
268 uint32_t gen;
269 uint64_t gen64;
270 uint64_t object;
271 zfid_short_t *zfid;
272 int size, i, error;
273
274 if (zfsctl_is_node(vp))
275 return zfsctl_vptofh(vp, fidp, fh_size);
276
277 zp = VTOZ(vp);
278 zfsvfs = zp->z_zfsvfs;
279 object = zp->z_id;
280
281 ZFS_ENTER(zfsvfs);
282 ZFS_VERIFY_ZP(zp);
283
284 if ((error = sa_lookup(zp->z_sa_hdl, SA_ZPL_GEN(zfsvfs),
285 &gen64, sizeof (uint64_t))) != 0) {
286 ZFS_EXIT(zfsvfs);
287 return (error);
288 }
289
290 gen = (uint32_t)gen64;
291
292 size = (zfsvfs->z_parent != zfsvfs) ? LONG_FID_LEN : SHORT_FID_LEN;
293
294 if (*fh_size < size) {
295 ZFS_EXIT(zfsvfs);
296 *fh_size = size;
297 return SET_ERROR(E2BIG);
298 }
299 *fh_size = size;
300
301 zfid = (zfid_short_t *)fidp;
302
303 zfid->zf_len = size;
304
305 for (i = 0; i < sizeof (zfid->zf_object); i++)
306 zfid->zf_object[i] = (uint8_t)(object >> (8 * i));
307
308 /* Must have a non-zero generation number to distinguish from .zfs */
309 if (gen == 0)
310 gen = 1;
311 for (i = 0; i < sizeof (zfid->zf_gen); i++)
312 zfid->zf_gen[i] = (uint8_t)(gen >> (8 * i));
313
314 if (size == LONG_FID_LEN) {
315 uint64_t objsetid = dmu_objset_id(zfsvfs->z_os);
316 zfid_long_t *zlfid;
317
318 zlfid = (zfid_long_t *)fidp;
319
320 for (i = 0; i < sizeof (zlfid->zf_setid); i++)
321 zlfid->zf_setid[i] = (uint8_t)(objsetid >> (8 * i));
322
323 /* XXX - this should be the generation number for the objset */
324 for (i = 0; i < sizeof (zlfid->zf_setgen); i++)
325 zlfid->zf_setgen[i] = 0;
326 }
327
328 ZFS_EXIT(zfsvfs);
329 return 0;
330}
331
332static int
333zfs_netbsd_fhtovp(vfs_t *vfsp, fid_t *fidp, vnode_t **vpp)
334{
335 zfsvfs_t *zfsvfs = vfsp->vfs_data;
336 znode_t *zp;
337 vnode_t *dvp;
338 uint64_t object = 0;
339 uint64_t fid_gen = 0;
340 uint64_t gen_mask;
341 uint64_t zp_gen;
342 int i, err;
343
344 *vpp = NULL;
345
346 ZFS_ENTER(zfsvfs);
347
348 if (zfsvfs->z_parent == zfsvfs && fidp->fid_len == LONG_FID_LEN) {
349 zfid_long_t *zlfid = (zfid_long_t *)fidp;
350 uint64_t objsetid = 0;
351 uint64_t setgen = 0;
352
353 for (i = 0; i < sizeof (zlfid->zf_setid); i++)
354 objsetid |= ((uint64_t)zlfid->zf_setid[i]) << (8 * i);
355
356 for (i = 0; i < sizeof (zlfid->zf_setgen); i++)
357 setgen |= ((uint64_t)zlfid->zf_setgen[i]) << (8 * i);
358
359 ZFS_EXIT(zfsvfs);
360
361 err = zfsctl_lookup_objset(vfsp, objsetid, &zfsvfs);
362 if (err)
363 return (SET_ERROR(EINVAL));
364 ZFS_ENTER(zfsvfs);
365 }
366
367 if (fidp->fid_len == SHORT_FID_LEN || fidp->fid_len == LONG_FID_LEN) {
368 zfid_short_t *zfid = (zfid_short_t *)fidp;
369
370 for (i = 0; i < sizeof (zfid->zf_object); i++)
371 object |= ((uint64_t)zfid->zf_object[i]) << (8 * i);
372
373 for (i = 0; i < sizeof (zfid->zf_gen); i++)
374 fid_gen |= ((uint64_t)zfid->zf_gen[i]) << (8 * i);
375 } else {
376 ZFS_EXIT(zfsvfs);
377 return (SET_ERROR(EINVAL));
378 }
379
380 /* A zero fid_gen means we are in the .zfs control directories */
381 if (fid_gen == 0 &&
382 (object == ZFSCTL_INO_ROOT || object == ZFSCTL_INO_SNAPDIR)) {
383 ZFS_EXIT(zfsvfs);
384 if (object == ZFSCTL_INO_ROOT)
385 err = zfsctl_root(zfsvfs, vpp);
386 else
387 err = zfsctl_snapshot(zfsvfs, vpp);
388 if (err)
389 return err;
390 err = vn_lock(*vpp, LK_EXCLUSIVE);
391 if (err) {
392 vrele(*vpp);
393 *vpp = NULL;
394 return err;
395 }
396 return 0;
397 }
398
399 gen_mask = -1ULL >> (64 - 8 * i);
400
401 dprintf("getting %llu [%u mask %llx]\n", object, fid_gen, gen_mask);
402 if (err = zfs_zget(zfsvfs, object, &zp)) {
403 ZFS_EXIT(zfsvfs);
404 return SET_ERROR(ESTALE);
405 }
406 (void) sa_lookup(zp->z_sa_hdl, SA_ZPL_GEN(zfsvfs), &zp_gen,
407 sizeof (uint64_t));
408 zp_gen = zp_gen & gen_mask;
409 if (zp_gen == 0)
410 zp_gen = 1;
411 if (zp->z_unlinked || zp_gen != fid_gen) {
412 dprintf("znode gen (%u) != fid gen (%u)\n", zp_gen, fid_gen);
413 VN_RELE(ZTOV(zp));
414 ZFS_EXIT(zfsvfs);
415 return SET_ERROR(ESTALE);
416 }
417
418 *vpp = ZTOV(zp);
419 ZFS_EXIT(zfsvfs);
420 err = vn_lock(*vpp, LK_EXCLUSIVE);
421 if (err) {
422 vrele(*vpp);
423 *vpp = NULL;
424 return err;
425 }
426 return 0;
427}
428#endif /* __NetBSD__ */
429
430/*
431 * We need to keep a count of active fs's.
432 * This is necessary to prevent our module
433 * from being unloaded after a umount -f
434 */
435static uint32_t zfs_active_fs_count = 0;
436
437/*ARGSUSED*/
438static int
439zfs_sync(vfs_t *vfsp, int waitfor)
440{
441 /*
442 * Data integrity is job one. We don't want a compromised kernel
443 * writing to the storage pool, so we never sync during panic.
444 */
445 if (panicstr)
446 return (0);
447
448 /*
449 * Ignore the system syncher. ZFS already commits async data
450 * at zfs_txg_timeout intervals.
451 */
452 if (waitfor == MNT_LAZY)
453 return (0);
454
455 if (vfsp != NULL) {
456 /*
457 * Sync a specific filesystem.
458 */
459 zfsvfs_t *zfsvfs = vfsp->vfs_data;
460 dsl_pool_t *dp;
461 int error;
462
463 error = vfs_stdsync(vfsp, waitfor);
464 if (error != 0)
465 return (error);
466
467 ZFS_ENTER(zfsvfs);
468 dp = dmu_objset_pool(zfsvfs->z_os);
469
470 /*
471 * If the system is shutting down, then skip any
472 * filesystems which may exist on a suspended pool.
473 */
474 if (sys_shutdown && spa_suspended(dp->dp_spa)) {
475 ZFS_EXIT(zfsvfs);
476 return (0);
477 }
478
479 if (zfsvfs->z_log != NULL)
480 zil_commit(zfsvfs->z_log, 0);
481
482 ZFS_EXIT(zfsvfs);
483 } else {
484 /*
485 * Sync all ZFS filesystems. This is what happens when you
486 * run sync(1M). Unlike other filesystems, ZFS honors the
487 * request by waiting for all pools to commit all dirty data.
488 */
489 spa_sync_allpools();
490 }
491
492 return (0);
493}
494
495#ifdef illumos
496static int
497zfs_create_unique_device(dev_t *dev)
498{
499 major_t new_major;
500
501 do {
502 ASSERT3U(zfs_minor, <=, MAXMIN32);
503 minor_t start = zfs_minor;
504 do {
505 mutex_enter(&zfs_dev_mtx);
506 if (zfs_minor >= MAXMIN32) {
507 /*
508 * If we're still using the real major
509 * keep out of /dev/zfs and /dev/zvol minor
510 * number space. If we're using a getudev()'ed
511 * major number, we can use all of its minors.
512 */
513 if (zfs_major == ddi_name_to_major(ZFS_DRIVER))
514 zfs_minor = ZFS_MIN_MINOR;
515 else
516 zfs_minor = 0;
517 } else {
518 zfs_minor++;
519 }
520 *dev = makedevice(zfs_major, zfs_minor);
521 mutex_exit(&zfs_dev_mtx);
522 } while (vfs_devismounted(*dev) && zfs_minor != start);
523#ifdef illumos
524 if (zfs_minor == start) {
525 /*
526 * We are using all ~262,000 minor numbers for the
527 * current major number. Create a new major number.
528 */
529 if ((new_major = getudev()) == (major_t)-1) {
530 cmn_err(CE_WARN,
531 "zfs_mount: Can't get unique major "
532 "device number.");
533 return (-1);
534 }
535 mutex_enter(&zfs_dev_mtx);
536 zfs_major = new_major;
537 zfs_minor = 0;
538
539 mutex_exit(&zfs_dev_mtx);
540 } else {
541 break;
542 }
543 /* CONSTANTCONDITION */
544#endif
545 } while (1);
546
547 return (0);
548}
549#endif /* illumos */
550
551
552static void
553atime_changed_cb(void *arg, uint64_t newval)
554{
555 zfsvfs_t *zfsvfs = arg;
556
557 if (newval == TRUE) {
558 zfsvfs->z_atime = TRUE;
559 zfsvfs->z_vfs->vfs_flag &= ~MNT_NOATIME;
560 vfs_clearmntopt(zfsvfs->z_vfs, MNTOPT_NOATIME);
561 vfs_setmntopt(zfsvfs->z_vfs, MNTOPT_ATIME, NULL, 0);
562 } else {
563 zfsvfs->z_atime = FALSE;
564 zfsvfs->z_vfs->vfs_flag |= MNT_NOATIME;
565 vfs_clearmntopt(zfsvfs->z_vfs, MNTOPT_ATIME);
566 vfs_setmntopt(zfsvfs->z_vfs, MNTOPT_NOATIME, NULL, 0);
567 }
568}
569
570static void
571xattr_changed_cb(void *arg, uint64_t newval)
572{
573 zfsvfs_t *zfsvfs = arg;
574
575 if (newval == TRUE) {
576 /* XXX locking on vfs_flag? */
577#ifdef TODO
578 zfsvfs->z_vfs->vfs_flag |= VFS_XATTR;
579#endif
580 vfs_clearmntopt(zfsvfs->z_vfs, MNTOPT_NOXATTR);
581 vfs_setmntopt(zfsvfs->z_vfs, MNTOPT_XATTR, NULL, 0);
582 } else {
583 /* XXX locking on vfs_flag? */
584#ifdef TODO
585 zfsvfs->z_vfs->vfs_flag &= ~VFS_XATTR;
586#endif
587 vfs_clearmntopt(zfsvfs->z_vfs, MNTOPT_XATTR);
588 vfs_setmntopt(zfsvfs->z_vfs, MNTOPT_NOXATTR, NULL, 0);
589 }
590}
591
592static void
593blksz_changed_cb(void *arg, uint64_t newval)
594{
595 zfsvfs_t *zfsvfs = arg;
596 ASSERT3U(newval, <=, spa_maxblocksize(dmu_objset_spa(zfsvfs->z_os)));
597 ASSERT3U(newval, >=, SPA_MINBLOCKSIZE);
598 ASSERT(ISP2(newval));
599
600 zfsvfs->z_max_blksz = newval;
601 zfsvfs->z_vfs->mnt_stat.f_iosize = newval;
602}
603
604static void
605readonly_changed_cb(void *arg, uint64_t newval)
606{
607 zfsvfs_t *zfsvfs = arg;
608
609 if (newval) {
610 /* XXX locking on vfs_flag? */
611 zfsvfs->z_vfs->vfs_flag |= VFS_RDONLY;
612 vfs_clearmntopt(zfsvfs->z_vfs, MNTOPT_RW);
613 vfs_setmntopt(zfsvfs->z_vfs, MNTOPT_RO, NULL, 0);
614 } else {
615 /* XXX locking on vfs_flag? */
616 zfsvfs->z_vfs->vfs_flag &= ~VFS_RDONLY;
617 vfs_clearmntopt(zfsvfs->z_vfs, MNTOPT_RO);
618 vfs_setmntopt(zfsvfs->z_vfs, MNTOPT_RW, NULL, 0);
619 }
620}
621
622static void
623setuid_changed_cb(void *arg, uint64_t newval)
624{
625 zfsvfs_t *zfsvfs = arg;
626
627 if (newval == FALSE) {
628 zfsvfs->z_vfs->vfs_flag |= VFS_NOSETUID;
629 vfs_clearmntopt(zfsvfs->z_vfs, MNTOPT_SETUID);
630 vfs_setmntopt(zfsvfs->z_vfs, MNTOPT_NOSETUID, NULL, 0);
631 } else {
632 zfsvfs->z_vfs->vfs_flag &= ~VFS_NOSETUID;
633 vfs_clearmntopt(zfsvfs->z_vfs, MNTOPT_NOSETUID);
634 vfs_setmntopt(zfsvfs->z_vfs, MNTOPT_SETUID, NULL, 0);
635 }
636}
637
638static void
639exec_changed_cb(void *arg, uint64_t newval)
640{
641 zfsvfs_t *zfsvfs = arg;
642
643 if (newval == FALSE) {
644 zfsvfs->z_vfs->vfs_flag |= VFS_NOEXEC;
645 vfs_clearmntopt(zfsvfs->z_vfs, MNTOPT_EXEC);
646 vfs_setmntopt(zfsvfs->z_vfs, MNTOPT_NOEXEC, NULL, 0);
647 } else {
648 zfsvfs->z_vfs->vfs_flag &= ~VFS_NOEXEC;
649 vfs_clearmntopt(zfsvfs->z_vfs, MNTOPT_NOEXEC);
650 vfs_setmntopt(zfsvfs->z_vfs, MNTOPT_EXEC, NULL, 0);
651 }
652}
653
654/*
655 * The nbmand mount option can be changed at mount time.
656 * We can't allow it to be toggled on live file systems or incorrect
657 * behavior may be seen from cifs clients
658 *
659 * This property isn't registered via dsl_prop_register(), but this callback
660 * will be called when a file system is first mounted
661 */
662static void
663nbmand_changed_cb(void *arg, uint64_t newval)
664{
665 zfsvfs_t *zfsvfs = arg;
666 if (newval == FALSE) {
667 vfs_clearmntopt(zfsvfs->z_vfs, MNTOPT_NBMAND);
668 vfs_setmntopt(zfsvfs->z_vfs, MNTOPT_NONBMAND, NULL, 0);
669 } else {
670 vfs_clearmntopt(zfsvfs->z_vfs, MNTOPT_NONBMAND);
671 vfs_setmntopt(zfsvfs->z_vfs, MNTOPT_NBMAND, NULL, 0);
672 }
673}
674
675static void
676snapdir_changed_cb(void *arg, uint64_t newval)
677{
678 zfsvfs_t *zfsvfs = arg;
679
680 zfsvfs->z_show_ctldir = newval;
681}
682
683static void
684vscan_changed_cb(void *arg, uint64_t newval)
685{
686 zfsvfs_t *zfsvfs = arg;
687
688 zfsvfs->z_vscan = newval;
689}
690
691static void
692acl_mode_changed_cb(void *arg, uint64_t newval)
693{
694 zfsvfs_t *zfsvfs = arg;
695
696 zfsvfs->z_acl_mode = newval;
697}
698
699static void
700acl_inherit_changed_cb(void *arg, uint64_t newval)
701{
702 zfsvfs_t *zfsvfs = arg;
703
704 zfsvfs->z_acl_inherit = newval;
705}
706
707static int
708zfs_register_callbacks(vfs_t *vfsp)
709{
710 struct dsl_dataset *ds = NULL;
711 objset_t *os = NULL;
712 zfsvfs_t *zfsvfs = NULL;
713 uint64_t nbmand;
714 boolean_t readonly = B_FALSE;
715 boolean_t do_readonly = B_FALSE;
716 boolean_t setuid = B_FALSE;
717 boolean_t do_setuid = B_FALSE;
718 boolean_t exec = B_FALSE;
719 boolean_t do_exec = B_FALSE;
720#ifdef illumos
721 boolean_t devices = B_FALSE;
722 boolean_t do_devices = B_FALSE;
723#endif
724 boolean_t xattr = B_FALSE;
725 boolean_t do_xattr = B_FALSE;
726 boolean_t atime = B_FALSE;
727 boolean_t do_atime = B_FALSE;
728 int error = 0;
729
730 ASSERT(vfsp);
731 zfsvfs = vfsp->vfs_data;
732 ASSERT(zfsvfs);
733 os = zfsvfs->z_os;
734
735 /*
736 * This function can be called for a snapshot when we update snapshot's
737 * mount point, which isn't really supported.
738 */
739 if (dmu_objset_is_snapshot(os))
740 return (EOPNOTSUPP);
741
742 /*
743 * The act of registering our callbacks will destroy any mount
744 * options we may have. In order to enable temporary overrides
745 * of mount options, we stash away the current values and
746 * restore them after we register the callbacks.
747 */
748 if (vfs_optionisset(vfsp, MNTOPT_RO, NULL) ||
749 !spa_writeable(dmu_objset_spa(os))) {
750 readonly = B_TRUE;
751 do_readonly = B_TRUE;
752 } else if (vfs_optionisset(vfsp, MNTOPT_RW, NULL)) {
753 readonly = B_FALSE;
754 do_readonly = B_TRUE;
755 }
756 if (vfs_optionisset(vfsp, MNTOPT_NOSUID, NULL)) {
757 setuid = B_FALSE;
758 do_setuid = B_TRUE;
759 } else {
760 if (vfs_optionisset(vfsp, MNTOPT_NOSETUID, NULL)) {
761 setuid = B_FALSE;
762 do_setuid = B_TRUE;
763 } else if (vfs_optionisset(vfsp, MNTOPT_SETUID, NULL)) {
764 setuid = B_TRUE;
765 do_setuid = B_TRUE;
766 }
767 }
768 if (vfs_optionisset(vfsp, MNTOPT_NOEXEC, NULL)) {
769 exec = B_FALSE;
770 do_exec = B_TRUE;
771 } else if (vfs_optionisset(vfsp, MNTOPT_EXEC, NULL)) {
772 exec = B_TRUE;
773 do_exec = B_TRUE;
774 }
775 if (vfs_optionisset(vfsp, MNTOPT_NOXATTR, NULL)) {
776 xattr = B_FALSE;
777 do_xattr = B_TRUE;
778 } else if (vfs_optionisset(vfsp, MNTOPT_XATTR, NULL)) {
779 xattr = B_TRUE;
780 do_xattr = B_TRUE;
781 }
782 if (vfs_optionisset(vfsp, MNTOPT_NOATIME, NULL)) {
783 atime = B_FALSE;
784 do_atime = B_TRUE;
785 } else if (vfs_optionisset(vfsp, MNTOPT_ATIME, NULL)) {
786 atime = B_TRUE;
787 do_atime = B_TRUE;
788 }
789
790 /*
791 * We need to enter pool configuration here, so that we can use
792 * dsl_prop_get_int_ds() to handle the special nbmand property below.
793 * dsl_prop_get_integer() can not be used, because it has to acquire
794 * spa_namespace_lock and we can not do that because we already hold
795 * z_teardown_lock. The problem is that spa_config_sync() is called
796 * with spa_namespace_lock held and the function calls ZFS vnode
797 * operations to write the cache file and thus z_teardown_lock is
798 * acquired after spa_namespace_lock.
799 */
800 ds = dmu_objset_ds(os);
801 dsl_pool_config_enter(dmu_objset_pool(os), FTAG);
802
803 /*
804 * nbmand is a special property. It can only be changed at
805 * mount time.
806 *
807 * This is weird, but it is documented to only be changeable
808 * at mount time.
809 */
810 if (vfs_optionisset(vfsp, MNTOPT_NONBMAND, NULL)) {
811 nbmand = B_FALSE;
812 } else if (vfs_optionisset(vfsp, MNTOPT_NBMAND, NULL)) {
813 nbmand = B_TRUE;
814 } else if (error = dsl_prop_get_int_ds(ds, "nbmand", &nbmand) != 0) {
815 dsl_pool_config_exit(dmu_objset_pool(os), FTAG);
816 return (error);
817 }
818
819 /*
820 * Register property callbacks.
821 *
822 * It would probably be fine to just check for i/o error from
823 * the first prop_register(), but I guess I like to go
824 * overboard...
825 */
826 error = dsl_prop_register(ds,
827 zfs_prop_to_name(ZFS_PROP_ATIME), atime_changed_cb, zfsvfs);
828 error = error ? error : dsl_prop_register(ds,
829 zfs_prop_to_name(ZFS_PROP_XATTR), xattr_changed_cb, zfsvfs);
830 error = error ? error : dsl_prop_register(ds,
831 zfs_prop_to_name(ZFS_PROP_RECORDSIZE), blksz_changed_cb, zfsvfs);
832 error = error ? error : dsl_prop_register(ds,
833 zfs_prop_to_name(ZFS_PROP_READONLY), readonly_changed_cb, zfsvfs);
834#ifdef illumos
835 error = error ? error : dsl_prop_register(ds,
836 zfs_prop_to_name(ZFS_PROP_DEVICES), devices_changed_cb, zfsvfs);
837#endif
838 error = error ? error : dsl_prop_register(ds,
839 zfs_prop_to_name(ZFS_PROP_SETUID), setuid_changed_cb, zfsvfs);
840 error = error ? error : dsl_prop_register(ds,
841 zfs_prop_to_name(ZFS_PROP_EXEC), exec_changed_cb, zfsvfs);
842 error = error ? error : dsl_prop_register(ds,
843 zfs_prop_to_name(ZFS_PROP_SNAPDIR), snapdir_changed_cb, zfsvfs);
844 error = error ? error : dsl_prop_register(ds,
845 zfs_prop_to_name(ZFS_PROP_ACLMODE), acl_mode_changed_cb, zfsvfs);
846 error = error ? error : dsl_prop_register(ds,
847 zfs_prop_to_name(ZFS_PROP_ACLINHERIT), acl_inherit_changed_cb,
848 zfsvfs);
849 error = error ? error : dsl_prop_register(ds,
850 zfs_prop_to_name(ZFS_PROP_VSCAN), vscan_changed_cb, zfsvfs);
851 dsl_pool_config_exit(dmu_objset_pool(os), FTAG);
852 if (error)
853 goto unregister;
854
855 /*
856 * Invoke our callbacks to restore temporary mount options.
857 */
858 if (do_readonly)
859 readonly_changed_cb(zfsvfs, readonly);
860 if (do_setuid)
861 setuid_changed_cb(zfsvfs, setuid);
862 if (do_exec)
863 exec_changed_cb(zfsvfs, exec);
864 if (do_xattr)
865 xattr_changed_cb(zfsvfs, xattr);
866 if (do_atime)
867 atime_changed_cb(zfsvfs, atime);
868
869 nbmand_changed_cb(zfsvfs, nbmand);
870
871 return (0);
872
873unregister:
874 dsl_prop_unregister_all(ds, zfsvfs);
875 return (error);
876}
877
878static int
879zfs_space_delta_cb(dmu_object_type_t bonustype, void *data,
880 uint64_t *userp, uint64_t *groupp)
881{
882 /*
883 * Is it a valid type of object to track?
884 */
885 if (bonustype != DMU_OT_ZNODE && bonustype != DMU_OT_SA)
886 return (SET_ERROR(ENOENT));
887
888 /*
889 * If we have a NULL data pointer
890 * then assume the id's aren't changing and
891 * return EEXIST to the dmu to let it know to
892 * use the same ids
893 */
894 if (data == NULL)
895 return (SET_ERROR(EEXIST));
896
897 if (bonustype == DMU_OT_ZNODE) {
898 znode_phys_t *znp = data;
899 *userp = znp->zp_uid;
900 *groupp = znp->zp_gid;
901 } else {
902 int hdrsize;
903 sa_hdr_phys_t *sap = data;
904 sa_hdr_phys_t sa = *sap;
905 boolean_t swap = B_FALSE;
906
907 ASSERT(bonustype == DMU_OT_SA);
908
909 if (sa.sa_magic == 0) {
910 /*
911 * This should only happen for newly created
912 * files that haven't had the znode data filled
913 * in yet.
914 */
915 *userp = 0;
916 *groupp = 0;
917 return (0);
918 }
919 if (sa.sa_magic == BSWAP_32(SA_MAGIC)) {
920 sa.sa_magic = SA_MAGIC;
921 sa.sa_layout_info = BSWAP_16(sa.sa_layout_info);
922 swap = B_TRUE;
923 } else {
924 VERIFY3U(sa.sa_magic, ==, SA_MAGIC);
925 }
926
927 hdrsize = sa_hdrsize(&sa);
928 VERIFY3U(hdrsize, >=, sizeof (sa_hdr_phys_t));
929 *userp = *((uint64_t *)((uintptr_t)data + hdrsize +
930 SA_UID_OFFSET));
931 *groupp = *((uint64_t *)((uintptr_t)data + hdrsize +
932 SA_GID_OFFSET));
933 if (swap) {
934 *userp = BSWAP_64(*userp);
935 *groupp = BSWAP_64(*groupp);
936 }
937 }
938 return (0);
939}
940
941static void
942fuidstr_to_sid(zfsvfs_t *zfsvfs, const char *fuidstr,
943 char *domainbuf, int buflen, uid_t *ridp)
944{
945 uint64_t fuid;
946 const char *domain;
947
948 fuid = strtonum(fuidstr, NULL);
949
950 domain = zfs_fuid_find_by_idx(zfsvfs, FUID_INDEX(fuid));
951 if (domain)
952 (void) strlcpy(domainbuf, domain, buflen);
953 else
954 domainbuf[0] = '\0';
955 *ridp = FUID_RID(fuid);
956}
957
958static uint64_t
959zfs_userquota_prop_to_obj(zfsvfs_t *zfsvfs, zfs_userquota_prop_t type)
960{
961 switch (type) {
962 case ZFS_PROP_USERUSED:
963 return (DMU_USERUSED_OBJECT);
964 case ZFS_PROP_GROUPUSED:
965 return (DMU_GROUPUSED_OBJECT);
966 case ZFS_PROP_USERQUOTA:
967 return (zfsvfs->z_userquota_obj);
968 case ZFS_PROP_GROUPQUOTA:
969 return (zfsvfs->z_groupquota_obj);
970 }
971 return (0);
972}
973
974int
975zfs_userspace_many(zfsvfs_t *zfsvfs, zfs_userquota_prop_t type,
976 uint64_t *cookiep, void *vbuf, uint64_t *bufsizep)
977{
978 int error;
979 zap_cursor_t zc;
980 zap_attribute_t za;
981 zfs_useracct_t *buf = vbuf;
982 uint64_t obj;
983
984 if (!dmu_objset_userspace_present(zfsvfs->z_os))
985 return (SET_ERROR(ENOTSUP));
986
987 obj = zfs_userquota_prop_to_obj(zfsvfs, type);
988 if (obj == 0) {
989 *bufsizep = 0;
990 return (0);
991 }
992
993 for (zap_cursor_init_serialized(&zc, zfsvfs->z_os, obj, *cookiep);
994 (error = zap_cursor_retrieve(&zc, &za)) == 0;
995 zap_cursor_advance(&zc)) {
996 if ((uintptr_t)buf - (uintptr_t)vbuf + sizeof (zfs_useracct_t) >
997 *bufsizep)
998 break;
999
1000 fuidstr_to_sid(zfsvfs, za.za_name,
1001 buf->zu_domain, sizeof (buf->zu_domain), &buf->zu_rid);
1002
1003 buf->zu_space = za.za_first_integer;
1004 buf++;
1005 }
1006 if (error == ENOENT)
1007 error = 0;
1008
1009 ASSERT3U((uintptr_t)buf - (uintptr_t)vbuf, <=, *bufsizep);
1010 *bufsizep = (uintptr_t)buf - (uintptr_t)vbuf;
1011 *cookiep = zap_cursor_serialize(&zc);
1012 zap_cursor_fini(&zc);
1013 return (error);
1014}
1015
1016/*
1017 * buf must be big enough (eg, 32 bytes)
1018 */
1019static int
1020id_to_fuidstr(zfsvfs_t *zfsvfs, const char *domain, uid_t rid,
1021 char *buf, boolean_t addok)
1022{
1023 uint64_t fuid;
1024 int domainid = 0;
1025
1026 if (domain && domain[0]) {
1027 domainid = zfs_fuid_find_by_domain(zfsvfs, domain, NULL, addok);
1028 if (domainid == -1)
1029 return (SET_ERROR(ENOENT));
1030 }
1031 fuid = FUID_ENCODE(domainid, rid);
1032 (void) sprintf(buf, "%llx", (longlong_t)fuid);
1033 return (0);
1034}
1035
1036int
1037zfs_userspace_one(zfsvfs_t *zfsvfs, zfs_userquota_prop_t type,
1038 const char *domain, uint64_t rid, uint64_t *valp)
1039{
1040 char buf[32];
1041 int err;
1042 uint64_t obj;
1043
1044 *valp = 0;
1045
1046 if (!dmu_objset_userspace_present(zfsvfs->z_os))
1047 return (SET_ERROR(ENOTSUP));
1048
1049 obj = zfs_userquota_prop_to_obj(zfsvfs, type);
1050 if (obj == 0)
1051 return (0);
1052
1053 err = id_to_fuidstr(zfsvfs, domain, rid, buf, B_FALSE);
1054 if (err)
1055 return (err);
1056
1057 err = zap_lookup(zfsvfs->z_os, obj, buf, 8, 1, valp);
1058 if (err == ENOENT)
1059 err = 0;
1060 return (err);
1061}
1062
1063int
1064zfs_set_userquota(zfsvfs_t *zfsvfs, zfs_userquota_prop_t type,
1065 const char *domain, uint64_t rid, uint64_t quota)
1066{
1067 char buf[32];
1068 int err;
1069 dmu_tx_t *tx;
1070 uint64_t *objp;
1071 boolean_t fuid_dirtied;
1072
1073 if (type != ZFS_PROP_USERQUOTA && type != ZFS_PROP_GROUPQUOTA)
1074 return (SET_ERROR(EINVAL));
1075
1076 if (zfsvfs->z_version < ZPL_VERSION_USERSPACE)
1077 return (SET_ERROR(ENOTSUP));
1078
1079 objp = (type == ZFS_PROP_USERQUOTA) ? &zfsvfs->z_userquota_obj :
1080 &zfsvfs->z_groupquota_obj;
1081
1082 err = id_to_fuidstr(zfsvfs, domain, rid, buf, B_TRUE);
1083 if (err)
1084 return (err);
1085 fuid_dirtied = zfsvfs->z_fuid_dirty;
1086
1087 tx = dmu_tx_create(zfsvfs->z_os);
1088 dmu_tx_hold_zap(tx, *objp ? *objp : DMU_NEW_OBJECT, B_TRUE, NULL);
1089 if (*objp == 0) {
1090 dmu_tx_hold_zap(tx, MASTER_NODE_OBJ, B_TRUE,
1091 zfs_userquota_prop_prefixes[type]);
1092 }
1093 if (fuid_dirtied)
1094 zfs_fuid_txhold(zfsvfs, tx);
1095 err = dmu_tx_assign(tx, TXG_WAIT);
1096 if (err) {
1097 dmu_tx_abort(tx);
1098 return (err);
1099 }
1100
1101 mutex_enter(&zfsvfs->z_lock);
1102 if (*objp == 0) {
1103 *objp = zap_create(zfsvfs->z_os, DMU_OT_USERGROUP_QUOTA,
1104 DMU_OT_NONE, 0, tx);
1105 VERIFY(0 == zap_add(zfsvfs->z_os, MASTER_NODE_OBJ,
1106 zfs_userquota_prop_prefixes[type], 8, 1, objp, tx));
1107 }
1108 mutex_exit(&zfsvfs->z_lock);
1109
1110 if (quota == 0) {
1111 err = zap_remove(zfsvfs->z_os, *objp, buf, tx);
1112 if (err == ENOENT)
1113 err = 0;
1114 } else {
1115 err = zap_update(zfsvfs->z_os, *objp, buf, 8, 1, &quota, tx);
1116 }
1117 ASSERT(err == 0);
1118 if (fuid_dirtied)
1119 zfs_fuid_sync(zfsvfs, tx);
1120 dmu_tx_commit(tx);
1121 return (err);
1122}
1123
1124boolean_t
1125zfs_fuid_overquota(zfsvfs_t *zfsvfs, boolean_t isgroup, uint64_t fuid)
1126{
1127 char buf[32];
1128 uint64_t used, quota, usedobj, quotaobj;
1129 int err;
1130
1131 usedobj = isgroup ? DMU_GROUPUSED_OBJECT : DMU_USERUSED_OBJECT;
1132 quotaobj = isgroup ? zfsvfs->z_groupquota_obj : zfsvfs->z_userquota_obj;
1133
1134 if (quotaobj == 0 || zfsvfs->z_replay)
1135 return (B_FALSE);
1136
1137 (void) sprintf(buf, "%llx", (longlong_t)fuid);
1138 err = zap_lookup(zfsvfs->z_os, quotaobj, buf, 8, 1, &quota);
1139 if (err != 0)
1140 return (B_FALSE);
1141
1142 err = zap_lookup(zfsvfs->z_os, usedobj, buf, 8, 1, &used);
1143 if (err != 0)
1144 return (B_FALSE);
1145 return (used >= quota);
1146}
1147
1148boolean_t
1149zfs_owner_overquota(zfsvfs_t *zfsvfs, znode_t *zp, boolean_t isgroup)
1150{
1151 uint64_t fuid;
1152 uint64_t quotaobj;
1153
1154 quotaobj = isgroup ? zfsvfs->z_groupquota_obj : zfsvfs->z_userquota_obj;
1155
1156 fuid = isgroup ? zp->z_gid : zp->z_uid;
1157
1158 if (quotaobj == 0 || zfsvfs->z_replay)
1159 return (B_FALSE);
1160
1161 return (zfs_fuid_overquota(zfsvfs, isgroup, fuid));
1162}
1163
1164/*
1165 * Associate this zfsvfs with the given objset, which must be owned.
1166 * This will cache a bunch of on-disk state from the objset in the
1167 * zfsvfs.
1168 */
1169static int
1170zfsvfs_init(zfsvfs_t *zfsvfs, objset_t *os)
1171{
1172 int error;
1173 uint64_t val;
1174
1175 zfsvfs->z_max_blksz = SPA_OLD_MAXBLOCKSIZE;
1176 zfsvfs->z_show_ctldir = ZFS_SNAPDIR_VISIBLE;
1177 zfsvfs->z_os = os;
1178
1179 error = zfs_get_zplprop(os, ZFS_PROP_VERSION, &zfsvfs->z_version);
1180 if (error != 0)
1181 return (error);
1182 if (zfsvfs->z_version >
1183 zfs_zpl_version_map(spa_version(dmu_objset_spa(os)))) {
1184 (void) printf("Can't mount a version %lld file system "
1185 "on a version %lld pool\n. Pool must be upgraded to mount "
1186 "this file system.", (u_longlong_t)zfsvfs->z_version,
1187 (u_longlong_t)spa_version(dmu_objset_spa(os)));
1188 return (SET_ERROR(ENOTSUP));
1189 }
1190 error = zfs_get_zplprop(os, ZFS_PROP_NORMALIZE, &val);
1191 if (error != 0)
1192 return (error);
1193 zfsvfs->z_norm = (int)val;
1194
1195 error = zfs_get_zplprop(os, ZFS_PROP_UTF8ONLY, &val);
1196 if (error != 0)
1197 return (error);
1198 zfsvfs->z_utf8 = (val != 0);
1199
1200 error = zfs_get_zplprop(os, ZFS_PROP_CASE, &val);
1201 if (error != 0)
1202 return (error);
1203 zfsvfs->z_case = (uint_t)val;
1204
1205 /*
1206 * Fold case on file systems that are always or sometimes case
1207 * insensitive.
1208 */
1209 if (zfsvfs->z_case == ZFS_CASE_INSENSITIVE ||
1210 zfsvfs->z_case == ZFS_CASE_MIXED)
1211 zfsvfs->z_norm |= U8_TEXTPREP_TOUPPER;
1212
1213 zfsvfs->z_use_fuids = USE_FUIDS(zfsvfs->z_version, zfsvfs->z_os);
1214 zfsvfs->z_use_sa = USE_SA(zfsvfs->z_version, zfsvfs->z_os);
1215
1216 uint64_t sa_obj = 0;
1217 if (zfsvfs->z_use_sa) {
1218 /* should either have both of these objects or none */
1219 error = zap_lookup(os, MASTER_NODE_OBJ, ZFS_SA_ATTRS, 8, 1,
1220 &sa_obj);
1221 if (error != 0)
1222 return (error);
1223 }
1224
1225 error = sa_setup(os, sa_obj, zfs_attr_table, ZPL_END,
1226 &zfsvfs->z_attr_table);
1227 if (error != 0)
1228 return (error);
1229
1230 if (zfsvfs->z_version >= ZPL_VERSION_SA)
1231 sa_register_update_callback(os, zfs_sa_upgrade);
1232
1233 error = zap_lookup(os, MASTER_NODE_OBJ, ZFS_ROOT_OBJ, 8, 1,
1234 &zfsvfs->z_root);
1235 if (error != 0)
1236 return (error);
1237 ASSERT(zfsvfs->z_root != 0);
1238
1239 error = zap_lookup(os, MASTER_NODE_OBJ, ZFS_UNLINKED_SET, 8, 1,
1240 &zfsvfs->z_unlinkedobj);
1241 if (error != 0)
1242 return (error);
1243
1244 error = zap_lookup(os, MASTER_NODE_OBJ,
1245 zfs_userquota_prop_prefixes[ZFS_PROP_USERQUOTA],
1246 8, 1, &zfsvfs->z_userquota_obj);
1247 if (error == ENOENT)
1248 zfsvfs->z_userquota_obj = 0;
1249 else if (error != 0)
1250 return (error);
1251
1252 error = zap_lookup(os, MASTER_NODE_OBJ,
1253 zfs_userquota_prop_prefixes[ZFS_PROP_GROUPQUOTA],
1254 8, 1, &zfsvfs->z_groupquota_obj);
1255 if (error == ENOENT)
1256 zfsvfs->z_groupquota_obj = 0;
1257 else if (error != 0)
1258 return (error);
1259
1260 error = zap_lookup(os, MASTER_NODE_OBJ, ZFS_FUID_TABLES, 8, 1,
1261 &zfsvfs->z_fuid_obj);
1262 if (error == ENOENT)
1263 zfsvfs->z_fuid_obj = 0;
1264 else if (error != 0)
1265 return (error);
1266
1267 error = zap_lookup(os, MASTER_NODE_OBJ, ZFS_SHARES_DIR, 8, 1,
1268 &zfsvfs->z_shares_dir);
1269 if (error == ENOENT)
1270 zfsvfs->z_shares_dir = 0;
1271 else if (error != 0)
1272 return (error);
1273
1274 /*
1275 * Only use the name cache if we are looking for a
1276 * name on a file system that does not require normalization
1277 * or case folding. We can also look there if we happen to be
1278 * on a non-normalizing, mixed sensitivity file system IF we
1279 * are looking for the exact name (which is always the case on
1280 * FreeBSD).
1281 */
1282 zfsvfs->z_use_namecache = !zfsvfs->z_norm ||
1283 ((zfsvfs->z_case == ZFS_CASE_MIXED) &&
1284 !(zfsvfs->z_norm & ~U8_TEXTPREP_TOUPPER));
1285
1286 return (0);
1287}
1288
1289int
1290zfsvfs_create(const char *osname, zfsvfs_t **zfvp)
1291{
1292 objset_t *os;
1293 zfsvfs_t *zfsvfs;
1294 int error;
1295
1296 /*
1297 * XXX: Fix struct statfs so this isn't necessary!
1298 *
1299 * The 'osname' is used as the filesystem's special node, which means
1300 * it must fit in statfs.f_mntfromname, or else it can't be
1301 * enumerated, so libzfs_mnttab_find() returns NULL, which causes
1302 * 'zfs unmount' to think it's not mounted when it is.
1303 */
1304 if (strlen(osname) >= MNAMELEN)
1305 return (SET_ERROR(ENAMETOOLONG));
1306
1307 zfsvfs = kmem_zalloc(sizeof (zfsvfs_t), KM_SLEEP);
1308
1309 /*
1310 * We claim to always be readonly so we can open snapshots;
1311 * other ZPL code will prevent us from writing to snapshots.
1312 */
1313 error = dmu_objset_own(osname, DMU_OST_ZFS, B_TRUE, zfsvfs, &os);
1314 if (error) {
1315 kmem_free(zfsvfs, sizeof (zfsvfs_t));
1316 return (error);
1317 }
1318
1319 zfsvfs->z_vfs = NULL;
1320 zfsvfs->z_parent = zfsvfs;
1321
1322 mutex_init(&zfsvfs->z_znodes_lock, NULL, MUTEX_DEFAULT, NULL);
1323 mutex_init(&zfsvfs->z_lock, NULL, MUTEX_DEFAULT, NULL);
1324 list_create(&zfsvfs->z_all_znodes, sizeof (znode_t),
1325 offsetof(znode_t, z_link_node));
1326#ifdef DIAGNOSTIC
1327 rrm_init(&zfsvfs->z_teardown_lock, B_TRUE);
1328#else
1329 rrm_init(&zfsvfs->z_teardown_lock, B_FALSE);
1330#endif
1331 rw_init(&zfsvfs->z_teardown_inactive_lock, NULL, RW_DEFAULT, NULL);
1332 rw_init(&zfsvfs->z_fuid_lock, NULL, RW_DEFAULT, NULL);
1333 for (int i = 0; i != ZFS_OBJ_MTX_SZ; i++)
1334 mutex_init(&zfsvfs->z_hold_mtx[i], NULL, MUTEX_DEFAULT, NULL);
1335
1336 error = zfsvfs_init(zfsvfs, os);
1337 if (error != 0) {
1338 dmu_objset_disown(os, zfsvfs);
1339 *zfvp = NULL;
1340 kmem_free(zfsvfs, sizeof (zfsvfs_t));
1341 return (error);
1342 }
1343
1344 *zfvp = zfsvfs;
1345 return (0);
1346}
1347
1348static int
1349zfsvfs_setup(zfsvfs_t *zfsvfs, boolean_t mounting)
1350{
1351 int error;
1352
1353 error = zfs_register_callbacks(zfsvfs->z_vfs);
1354 if (error)
1355 return (error);
1356
1357 zfsvfs->z_log = zil_open(zfsvfs->z_os, zfs_get_data);
1358
1359 /*
1360 * If we are not mounting (ie: online recv), then we don't
1361 * have to worry about replaying the log as we blocked all
1362 * operations out since we closed the ZIL.
1363 */
1364 if (mounting) {
1365 boolean_t readonly;
1366
1367 /*
1368 * During replay we remove the read only flag to
1369 * allow replays to succeed.
1370 */
1371 readonly = zfsvfs->z_vfs->vfs_flag & VFS_RDONLY;
1372 if (readonly != 0)
1373 zfsvfs->z_vfs->vfs_flag &= ~VFS_RDONLY;
1374 else
1375 zfs_unlinked_drain(zfsvfs);
1376
1377 /*
1378 * Parse and replay the intent log.
1379 *
1380 * Because of ziltest, this must be done after
1381 * zfs_unlinked_drain(). (Further note: ziltest
1382 * doesn't use readonly mounts, where
1383 * zfs_unlinked_drain() isn't called.) This is because
1384 * ziltest causes spa_sync() to think it's committed,
1385 * but actually it is not, so the intent log contains
1386 * many txg's worth of changes.
1387 *
1388 * In particular, if object N is in the unlinked set in
1389 * the last txg to actually sync, then it could be
1390 * actually freed in a later txg and then reallocated
1391 * in a yet later txg. This would write a "create
1392 * object N" record to the intent log. Normally, this
1393 * would be fine because the spa_sync() would have
1394 * written out the fact that object N is free, before
1395 * we could write the "create object N" intent log
1396 * record.
1397 *
1398 * But when we are in ziltest mode, we advance the "open
1399 * txg" without actually spa_sync()-ing the changes to
1400 * disk. So we would see that object N is still
1401 * allocated and in the unlinked set, and there is an
1402 * intent log record saying to allocate it.
1403 */
1404 if (spa_writeable(dmu_objset_spa(zfsvfs->z_os))) {
1405 if (zil_replay_disable) {
1406 zil_destroy(zfsvfs->z_log, B_FALSE);
1407 } else {
1408 zfsvfs->z_replay = B_TRUE;
1409 zil_replay(zfsvfs->z_os, zfsvfs,
1410 zfs_replay_vector);
1411 zfsvfs->z_replay = B_FALSE;
1412 }
1413 }
1414 zfsvfs->z_vfs->vfs_flag |= readonly; /* restore readonly bit */
1415 }
1416
1417 /*
1418 * Set the objset user_ptr to track its zfsvfs.
1419 */
1420 mutex_enter(&zfsvfs->z_os->os_user_ptr_lock);
1421 dmu_objset_set_user(zfsvfs->z_os, zfsvfs);
1422 mutex_exit(&zfsvfs->z_os->os_user_ptr_lock);
1423
1424 return (0);
1425}
1426
1427extern krwlock_t zfsvfs_lock; /* in zfs_znode.c */
1428
1429void
1430zfsvfs_free(zfsvfs_t *zfsvfs)
1431{
1432 int i;
1433
1434 /*
1435 * This is a barrier to prevent the filesystem from going away in
1436 * zfs_znode_move() until we can safely ensure that the filesystem is
1437 * not unmounted. We consider the filesystem valid before the barrier
1438 * and invalid after the barrier.
1439 */
1440 rw_enter(&zfsvfs_lock, RW_READER);
1441 rw_exit(&zfsvfs_lock);
1442
1443 zfs_fuid_destroy(zfsvfs);
1444
1445 mutex_destroy(&zfsvfs->z_znodes_lock);
1446 mutex_destroy(&zfsvfs->z_lock);
1447 list_destroy(&zfsvfs->z_all_znodes);
1448 rrm_destroy(&zfsvfs->z_teardown_lock);
1449 rw_destroy(&zfsvfs->z_teardown_inactive_lock);
1450 rw_destroy(&zfsvfs->z_fuid_lock);
1451 for (i = 0; i != ZFS_OBJ_MTX_SZ; i++)
1452 mutex_destroy(&zfsvfs->z_hold_mtx[i]);
1453 kmem_free(zfsvfs, sizeof (zfsvfs_t));
1454}
1455
1456static void
1457zfs_set_fuid_feature(zfsvfs_t *zfsvfs)
1458{
1459 zfsvfs->z_use_fuids = USE_FUIDS(zfsvfs->z_version, zfsvfs->z_os);
1460 if (zfsvfs->z_vfs) {
1461 if (zfsvfs->z_use_fuids) {
1462 vfs_set_feature(zfsvfs->z_vfs, VFSFT_XVATTR);
1463 vfs_set_feature(zfsvfs->z_vfs, VFSFT_SYSATTR_VIEWS);
1464 vfs_set_feature(zfsvfs->z_vfs, VFSFT_ACEMASKONACCESS);
1465 vfs_set_feature(zfsvfs->z_vfs, VFSFT_ACLONCREATE);
1466 vfs_set_feature(zfsvfs->z_vfs, VFSFT_ACCESS_FILTER);
1467 vfs_set_feature(zfsvfs->z_vfs, VFSFT_REPARSE);
1468 } else {
1469 vfs_clear_feature(zfsvfs->z_vfs, VFSFT_XVATTR);
1470 vfs_clear_feature(zfsvfs->z_vfs, VFSFT_SYSATTR_VIEWS);
1471 vfs_clear_feature(zfsvfs->z_vfs, VFSFT_ACEMASKONACCESS);
1472 vfs_clear_feature(zfsvfs->z_vfs, VFSFT_ACLONCREATE);
1473 vfs_clear_feature(zfsvfs->z_vfs, VFSFT_ACCESS_FILTER);
1474 vfs_clear_feature(zfsvfs->z_vfs, VFSFT_REPARSE);
1475 }
1476 }
1477 zfsvfs->z_use_sa = USE_SA(zfsvfs->z_version, zfsvfs->z_os);
1478}
1479
1480#ifdef __NetBSD__
1481int
1482#else
1483static int
1484#endif
1485zfs_domount(vfs_t *vfsp, char *osname)
1486{
1487 uint64_t recordsize, fsid_guid;
1488 int error = 0;
1489 zfsvfs_t *zfsvfs;
1490 vnode_t *vp;
1491
1492 ASSERT(vfsp);
1493 ASSERT(osname);
1494
1495 error = zfsvfs_create(osname, &zfsvfs);
1496 if (error)
1497 return (error);
1498 zfsvfs->z_vfs = vfsp;
1499
1500#ifdef illumos
1501 /* Initialize the generic filesystem structure. */
1502 vfsp->vfs_bcount = 0;
1503 vfsp->vfs_data = NULL;
1504
1505 if (zfs_create_unique_device(&mount_dev) == -1) {
1506 error = SET_ERROR(ENODEV);
1507 goto out;
1508 }
1509 ASSERT(vfs_devismounted(mount_dev) == 0);
1510#endif
1511
1512 if (error = dsl_prop_get_integer(osname, "recordsize", &recordsize,
1513 NULL))
1514 goto out;
1515 zfsvfs->z_vfs->vfs_bsize = SPA_MINBLOCKSIZE;
1516 zfsvfs->z_vfs->mnt_stat.f_iosize = recordsize;
1517
1518 vfsp->vfs_data = zfsvfs;
1519#ifdef __FreeBSD_kernel__
1520 vfsp->mnt_flag |= MNT_LOCAL;
1521 vfsp->mnt_kern_flag |= MNTK_LOOKUP_SHARED;
1522 vfsp->mnt_kern_flag |= MNTK_SHARED_WRITES;
1523 vfsp->mnt_kern_flag |= MNTK_EXTENDED_SHARED;
1524 vfsp->mnt_kern_flag |= MNTK_NO_IOPF; /* vn_io_fault can be used */
1525#endif
1526#ifdef __NetBSD__
1527 vfsp->mnt_flag |= MNT_LOCAL;
1528 vfsp->mnt_iflag |= IMNT_MPSAFE;
1529#endif
1530
1531 /*
1532 * The fsid is 64 bits, composed of an 8-bit fs type, which
1533 * separates our fsid from any other filesystem types, and a
1534 * 56-bit objset unique ID. The objset unique ID is unique to
1535 * all objsets open on this system, provided by unique_create().
1536 * The 8-bit fs type must be put in the low bits of fsid[1]
1537 * because that's where other Solaris filesystems put it.
1538 */
1539 fsid_guid = dmu_objset_fsid_guid(zfsvfs->z_os);
1540 ASSERT((fsid_guid & ~((1ULL<<56)-1)) == 0);
1541#ifdef __FreeBSD_kernel__
1542 vfsp->vfs_fsid.val[0] = fsid_guid;
1543 vfsp->vfs_fsid.val[1] = ((fsid_guid>>32) << 8) |
1544 vfsp->mnt_vfc->vfc_typenum & 0xFF;
1545#endif
1546#ifdef __NetBSD__
1547 vfsp->mnt_stat.f_fsidx.__fsid_val[0] = fsid_guid;
1548 vfsp->mnt_stat.f_fsidx.__fsid_val[1] = ((fsid_guid>>32) << 8) |
1549 makefstype(vfsp->mnt_op->vfs_name) & 0xFF;
1550 vfsp->mnt_stat.f_fsid = fsid_guid;
1551#endif
1552
1553 /*
1554 * Set features for file system.
1555 */
1556 zfs_set_fuid_feature(zfsvfs);
1557 if (zfsvfs->z_case == ZFS_CASE_INSENSITIVE) {
1558 vfs_set_feature(vfsp, VFSFT_DIRENTFLAGS);
1559 vfs_set_feature(vfsp, VFSFT_CASEINSENSITIVE);
1560 vfs_set_feature(vfsp, VFSFT_NOCASESENSITIVE);
1561 } else if (zfsvfs->z_case == ZFS_CASE_MIXED) {
1562 vfs_set_feature(vfsp, VFSFT_DIRENTFLAGS);
1563 vfs_set_feature(vfsp, VFSFT_CASEINSENSITIVE);
1564 }
1565 vfs_set_feature(vfsp, VFSFT_ZEROCOPY_SUPPORTED);
1566
1567 if (dmu_objset_is_snapshot(zfsvfs->z_os)) {
1568 uint64_t pval;
1569
1570 atime_changed_cb(zfsvfs, B_FALSE);
1571 readonly_changed_cb(zfsvfs, B_TRUE);
1572 if (error = dsl_prop_get_integer(osname, "xattr", &pval, NULL))
1573 goto out;
1574 xattr_changed_cb(zfsvfs, pval);
1575 zfsvfs->z_issnap = B_TRUE;
1576 zfsvfs->z_os->os_sync = ZFS_SYNC_DISABLED;
1577
1578 mutex_enter(&zfsvfs->z_os->os_user_ptr_lock);
1579 dmu_objset_set_user(zfsvfs->z_os, zfsvfs);
1580 mutex_exit(&zfsvfs->z_os->os_user_ptr_lock);
1581 } else {
1582 error = zfsvfs_setup(zfsvfs, B_TRUE);
1583 }
1584
1585#ifdef __FreeBSD_kernel__
1586 vfs_mountedfrom(vfsp, osname);
1587#endif
1588#ifdef __NetBSD__
1589 set_statvfs_info("on-name", UIO_SYSSPACE, osname, UIO_SYSSPACE, "zfs", vfsp, curlwp);
1590#endif
1591
1592 if (!zfsvfs->z_issnap)
1593 zfsctl_create(zfsvfs);
1594out:
1595 if (error) {
1596 dmu_objset_disown(zfsvfs->z_os, zfsvfs);
1597 zfsvfs_free(zfsvfs);
1598 } else {
1599 atomic_inc_32(&zfs_active_fs_count);
1600 }
1601
1602 return (error);
1603}
1604
1605void
1606zfs_unregister_callbacks(zfsvfs_t *zfsvfs)
1607{
1608 objset_t *os = zfsvfs->z_os;
1609
1610 if (!dmu_objset_is_snapshot(os))
1611 dsl_prop_unregister_all(dmu_objset_ds(os), zfsvfs);
1612}
1613
1614#ifdef SECLABEL
1615/*
1616 * Convert a decimal digit string to a uint64_t integer.
1617 */
1618static int
1619str_to_uint64(char *str, uint64_t *objnum)
1620{
1621 uint64_t num = 0;
1622
1623 while (*str) {
1624 if (*str < '0' || *str > '9')
1625 return (SET_ERROR(EINVAL));
1626
1627 num = num*10 + *str++ - '0';
1628 }
1629
1630 *objnum = num;
1631 return (0);
1632}
1633
1634/*
1635 * The boot path passed from the boot loader is in the form of
1636 * "rootpool-name/root-filesystem-object-number'. Convert this
1637 * string to a dataset name: "rootpool-name/root-filesystem-name".
1638 */
1639static int
1640zfs_parse_bootfs(char *bpath, char *outpath)
1641{
1642 char *slashp;
1643 uint64_t objnum;
1644 int error;
1645
1646 if (*bpath == 0 || *bpath == '/')
1647 return (SET_ERROR(EINVAL));
1648
1649 (void) strcpy(outpath, bpath);
1650
1651 slashp = strchr(bpath, '/');
1652
1653 /* if no '/', just return the pool name */
1654 if (slashp == NULL) {
1655 return (0);
1656 }
1657
1658 /* if not a number, just return the root dataset name */
1659 if (str_to_uint64(slashp+1, &objnum)) {
1660 return (0);
1661 }
1662
1663 *slashp = '\0';
1664 error = dsl_dsobj_to_dsname(bpath, objnum, outpath);
1665 *slashp = '/';
1666
1667 return (error);
1668}
1669
1670/*
1671 * Check that the hex label string is appropriate for the dataset being
1672 * mounted into the global_zone proper.
1673 *
1674 * Return an error if the hex label string is not default or
1675 * admin_low/admin_high. For admin_low labels, the corresponding
1676 * dataset must be readonly.
1677 */
1678int
1679zfs_check_global_label(const char *dsname, const char *hexsl)
1680{
1681 if (strcasecmp(hexsl, ZFS_MLSLABEL_DEFAULT) == 0)
1682 return (0);
1683 if (strcasecmp(hexsl, ADMIN_HIGH) == 0)
1684 return (0);
1685 if (strcasecmp(hexsl, ADMIN_LOW) == 0) {
1686 /* must be readonly */
1687 uint64_t rdonly;
1688
1689 if (dsl_prop_get_integer(dsname,
1690 zfs_prop_to_name(ZFS_PROP_READONLY), &rdonly, NULL))
1691 return (SET_ERROR(EACCES));
1692 return (rdonly ? 0 : EACCES);
1693 }
1694 return (SET_ERROR(EACCES));
1695}
1696
1697/*
1698 * Determine whether the mount is allowed according to MAC check.
1699 * by comparing (where appropriate) label of the dataset against
1700 * the label of the zone being mounted into. If the dataset has
1701 * no label, create one.
1702 *
1703 * Returns 0 if access allowed, error otherwise (e.g. EACCES)
1704 */
1705static int
1706zfs_mount_label_policy(vfs_t *vfsp, char *osname)
1707{
1708 int error, retv;
1709 zone_t *mntzone = NULL;
1710 ts_label_t *mnt_tsl;
1711 bslabel_t *mnt_sl;
1712 bslabel_t ds_sl;
1713 char ds_hexsl[MAXNAMELEN];
1714
1715 retv = EACCES; /* assume the worst */
1716
1717 /*
1718 * Start by getting the dataset label if it exists.
1719 */
1720 error = dsl_prop_get(osname, zfs_prop_to_name(ZFS_PROP_MLSLABEL),
1721 1, sizeof (ds_hexsl), &ds_hexsl, NULL);
1722 if (error)
1723 return (SET_ERROR(EACCES));
1724
1725 /*
1726 * If labeling is NOT enabled, then disallow the mount of datasets
1727 * which have a non-default label already. No other label checks
1728 * are needed.
1729 */
1730 if (!is_system_labeled()) {
1731 if (strcasecmp(ds_hexsl, ZFS_MLSLABEL_DEFAULT) == 0)
1732 return (0);
1733 return (SET_ERROR(EACCES));
1734 }
1735
1736 /*
1737 * Get the label of the mountpoint. If mounting into the global
1738 * zone (i.e. mountpoint is not within an active zone and the
1739 * zoned property is off), the label must be default or
1740 * admin_low/admin_high only; no other checks are needed.
1741 */
1742 mntzone = zone_find_by_any_path(refstr_value(vfsp->vfs_mntpt), B_FALSE);
1743 if (mntzone->zone_id == GLOBAL_ZONEID) {
1744 uint64_t zoned;
1745
1746 zone_rele(mntzone);
1747
1748 if (dsl_prop_get_integer(osname,
1749 zfs_prop_to_name(ZFS_PROP_ZONED), &zoned, NULL))
1750 return (SET_ERROR(EACCES));
1751 if (!zoned)
1752 return (zfs_check_global_label(osname, ds_hexsl));
1753 else
1754 /*
1755 * This is the case of a zone dataset being mounted
1756 * initially, before the zone has been fully created;
1757 * allow this mount into global zone.
1758 */
1759 return (0);
1760 }
1761
1762 mnt_tsl = mntzone->zone_slabel;
1763 ASSERT(mnt_tsl != NULL);
1764 label_hold(mnt_tsl);
1765 mnt_sl = label2bslabel(mnt_tsl);
1766
1767 if (strcasecmp(ds_hexsl, ZFS_MLSLABEL_DEFAULT) == 0) {
1768 /*
1769 * The dataset doesn't have a real label, so fabricate one.
1770 */
1771 char *str = NULL;
1772
1773 if (l_to_str_internal(mnt_sl, &str) == 0 &&
1774 dsl_prop_set_string(osname,
1775 zfs_prop_to_name(ZFS_PROP_MLSLABEL),
1776 ZPROP_SRC_LOCAL, str) == 0)
1777 retv = 0;
1778 if (str != NULL)
1779 kmem_free(str, strlen(str) + 1);
1780 } else if (hexstr_to_label(ds_hexsl, &ds_sl) == 0) {
1781 /*
1782 * Now compare labels to complete the MAC check. If the
1783 * labels are equal then allow access. If the mountpoint
1784 * label dominates the dataset label, allow readonly access.
1785 * Otherwise, access is denied.
1786 */
1787 if (blequal(mnt_sl, &ds_sl))
1788 retv = 0;
1789 else if (bldominates(mnt_sl, &ds_sl)) {
1790 vfs_setmntopt(vfsp, MNTOPT_RO, NULL, 0);
1791 retv = 0;
1792 }
1793 }
1794
1795 label_rele(mnt_tsl);
1796 zone_rele(mntzone);
1797 return (retv);
1798}
1799#endif /* SECLABEL */
1800
1801#ifdef OPENSOLARIS_MOUNTROOT
1802static int
1803zfs_mountroot(vfs_t *vfsp, enum whymountroot why)
1804{
1805 int error = 0;
1806 static int zfsrootdone = 0;
1807 zfsvfs_t *zfsvfs = NULL;
1808 znode_t *zp = NULL;
1809 vnode_t *vp = NULL;
1810 char *zfs_bootfs;
1811 char *zfs_devid;
1812
1813 ASSERT(vfsp);
1814
1815 /*
1816 * The filesystem that we mount as root is defined in the
1817 * boot property "zfs-bootfs" with a format of
1818 * "poolname/root-dataset-objnum".
1819 */
1820 if (why == ROOT_INIT) {
1821 if (zfsrootdone++)
1822 return (SET_ERROR(EBUSY));
1823 /*
1824 * the process of doing a spa_load will require the
1825 * clock to be set before we could (for example) do
1826 * something better by looking at the timestamp on
1827 * an uberblock, so just set it to -1.
1828 */
1829 clkset(-1);
1830
1831 if ((zfs_bootfs = spa_get_bootprop("zfs-bootfs")) == NULL) {
1832 cmn_err(CE_NOTE, "spa_get_bootfs: can not get "
1833 "bootfs name");
1834 return (SET_ERROR(EINVAL));
1835 }
1836 zfs_devid = spa_get_bootprop("diskdevid");
1837 error = spa_import_rootpool(rootfs.bo_name, zfs_devid);
1838 if (zfs_devid)
1839 spa_free_bootprop(zfs_devid);
1840 if (error) {
1841 spa_free_bootprop(zfs_bootfs);
1842 cmn_err(CE_NOTE, "spa_import_rootpool: error %d",
1843 error);
1844 return (error);
1845 }
1846 if (error = zfs_parse_bootfs(zfs_bootfs, rootfs.bo_name)) {
1847 spa_free_bootprop(zfs_bootfs);
1848 cmn_err(CE_NOTE, "zfs_parse_bootfs: error %d",
1849 error);
1850 return (error);
1851 }
1852
1853 spa_free_bootprop(zfs_bootfs);
1854
1855 if (error = vfs_lock(vfsp))
1856 return (error);
1857
1858 if (error = zfs_domount(vfsp, rootfs.bo_name)) {
1859 cmn_err(CE_NOTE, "zfs_domount: error %d", error);
1860 goto out;
1861 }
1862
1863 zfsvfs = (zfsvfs_t *)vfsp->vfs_data;
1864 ASSERT(zfsvfs);
1865 if (error = zfs_zget(zfsvfs, zfsvfs->z_root, &zp)) {
1866 cmn_err(CE_NOTE, "zfs_zget: error %d", error);
1867 goto out;
1868 }
1869
1870 vp = ZTOV(zp);
1871 mutex_enter(&vp->v_lock);
1872 vp->v_flag |= VROOT;
1873 mutex_exit(&vp->v_lock);
1874 rootvp = vp;
1875
1876 /*
1877 * Leave rootvp held. The root file system is never unmounted.
1878 */
1879
1880 vfs_add((struct vnode *)0, vfsp,
1881 (vfsp->vfs_flag & VFS_RDONLY) ? MS_RDONLY : 0);
1882out:
1883 vfs_unlock(vfsp);
1884 return (error);
1885 } else if (why == ROOT_REMOUNT) {
1886 readonly_changed_cb(vfsp->vfs_data, B_FALSE);
1887 vfsp->vfs_flag |= VFS_REMOUNT;
1888
1889 /* refresh mount options */
1890 zfs_unregister_callbacks(vfsp->vfs_data);
1891 return (zfs_register_callbacks(vfsp));
1892
1893 } else if (why == ROOT_UNMOUNT) {
1894 zfs_unregister_callbacks((zfsvfs_t *)vfsp->vfs_data);
1895 (void) zfs_sync(vfsp, 0, 0);
1896 return (0);
1897 }
1898
1899 /*
1900 * if "why" is equal to anything else other than ROOT_INIT,
1901 * ROOT_REMOUNT, or ROOT_UNMOUNT, we do not support it.
1902 */
1903 return (SET_ERROR(ENOTSUP));
1904}
1905#endif /* OPENSOLARIS_MOUNTROOT */
1906
1907static int
1908getpoolname(const char *osname, char *poolname)
1909{
1910 char *p;
1911
1912 p = strchr(osname, '/');
1913 if (p == NULL) {
1914 if (strlen(osname) >= MAXNAMELEN)
1915 return (ENAMETOOLONG);
1916 (void) strcpy(poolname, osname);
1917 } else {
1918 if (p - osname >= MAXNAMELEN)
1919 return (ENAMETOOLONG);
1920 (void) strncpy(poolname, osname, p - osname);
1921 poolname[p - osname] = '\0';
1922 }
1923 return (0);
1924}
1925
1926/*ARGSUSED*/
1927#ifdef illumos
1928static int
1929zfs_mount(vfs_t *vfsp, vnode_t *mvp, struct mounta *uap, cred_t *cr)
1930#endif
1931#ifdef __FreeBSD_kernel__
1932static int
1933zfs_mount(vfs_t *vfsp)
1934#endif
1935#ifdef __NetBSD__
1936static int
1937zfs_mount(vfs_t *vfsp, const char *path, void *data, size_t *data_len)
1938#endif
1939{
1940 vnode_t *mvp = vfsp->mnt_vnodecovered;
1941 char *osname;
1942 int error = 0;
1943 int canwrite;
1944
1945#ifdef illumos
1946 if (mvp->v_type != VDIR)
1947 return (SET_ERROR(ENOTDIR));
1948
1949 mutex_enter(&mvp->v_lock);
1950 if ((uap->flags & MS_REMOUNT) == 0 &&
1951 (uap->flags & MS_OVERLAY) == 0 &&
1952 (mvp->v_count != 1 || (mvp->v_flag & VROOT))) {
1953 mutex_exit(&mvp->v_lock);
1954 return (SET_ERROR(EBUSY));
1955 }
1956 mutex_exit(&mvp->v_lock);
1957
1958 /*
1959 * ZFS does not support passing unparsed data in via MS_DATA.
1960 * Users should use the MS_OPTIONSTR interface; this means
1961 * that all option parsing is already done and the options struct
1962 * can be interrogated.
1963 */
1964 if ((uap->flags & MS_DATA) && uap->datalen > 0)
1965 return (SET_ERROR(EINVAL));
1966#endif /* illumos */
1967
1968#ifdef __FreeBSD_kernel__
1969 kthread_t *td = curthread;
1970 cred_t *cr = td->td_ucred;
1971
1972 if (!prison_allow(td->td_ucred, PR_ALLOW_MOUNT_ZFS))
1973 return (SET_ERROR(EPERM));
1974
1975 if (vfs_getopt(vfsp->mnt_optnew, "from", (void **)&osname, NULL))
1976 return (SET_ERROR(EINVAL));
1977
1978 /*
1979 * If full-owner-access is enabled and delegated administration is
1980 * turned on, we must set nosuid.
1981 */
1982 if (zfs_super_owner &&
1983 dsl_deleg_access(osname, ZFS_DELEG_PERM_MOUNT, cr) != ECANCELED) {
1984 secpolicy_fs_mount_clearopts(cr, vfsp);
1985 }
1986
1987#endif /* __FreeBSD_kernel__ */
1988
1989#ifdef __NetBSD__
1990 cred_t *cr = CRED();
1991 struct mounta *uap = data;
1992
1993 if (uap == NULL)
1994 return (SET_ERROR(EINVAL));
1995
1996 if (mvp->v_type != VDIR)
1997 return (SET_ERROR(ENOTDIR));
1998
1999 mutex_enter(mvp->v_interlock);
2000 if ((uap->flags & MS_REMOUNT) == 0 &&
2001 (uap->flags & MS_OVERLAY) == 0 &&
2002 (mvp->v_count != 1 || (mvp->v_flag & VROOT))) {
2003 mutex_exit(mvp->v_interlock);
2004 return (SET_ERROR(EBUSY));
2005 }
2006 mutex_exit(mvp->v_interlock);
2007
2008 osname = PNBUF_GET();
2009 strlcpy(osname, uap->fspec, strlen(uap->fspec) + 1);
2010#endif /* __NetBSD__ */
2011
2012 /*
2013 * Check for mount privilege?
2014 *
2015 * If we don't have privilege then see if
2016 * we have local permission to allow it
2017 */
2018 error = secpolicy_fs_mount(cr, mvp, vfsp);
2019 if (error) {
2020 if (dsl_deleg_access(osname, ZFS_DELEG_PERM_MOUNT, cr) != 0)
2021 goto out;
2022
2023 if (!(vfsp->vfs_flag & MS_REMOUNT)) {
2024 vattr_t vattr;
2025
2026 /*
2027 * Make sure user is the owner of the mount point
2028 * or has sufficient privileges.
2029 */
2030
2031 vattr.va_mask = AT_UID;
2032
2033#ifdef __FreeBSD_kernel__
2034 vn_lock(mvp, LK_SHARED | LK_RETRY);
2035 if (VOP_GETATTR(mvp, &vattr, cr)) {
2036 VOP_UNLOCK(mvp, 0);
2037 goto out;
2038 }
2039
2040 if (secpolicy_vnode_owner(mvp, cr, vattr.va_uid) != 0 &&
2041 VOP_ACCESS(mvp, VWRITE, cr, td) != 0) {
2042 VOP_UNLOCK(mvp, 0);
2043 goto out;
2044 }
2045 VOP_UNLOCK(mvp, 0);
2046#endif
2047#ifdef __NetBSD__
2048 vn_lock(mvp, LK_SHARED | LK_RETRY);
2049 if (VOP_GETATTR(mvp, &vattr, 0, cr, NULL)) {
2050 VOP_UNLOCK(mvp, 0);
2051 goto out;
2052 }
2053
2054 if (secpolicy_vnode_owner(mvp, cr, vattr.va_uid) != 0 &&
2055 VOP_ACCESS(mvp, VWRITE, cr) != 0) {
2056 VOP_UNLOCK(mvp, 0);
2057 goto out;
2058 }
2059 VOP_UNLOCK(mvp, 0);
2060#endif
2061 }
2062
2063 secpolicy_fs_mount_clearopts(cr, vfsp);
2064 }
2065
2066 /*
2067 * Refuse to mount a filesystem if we are in a local zone and the
2068 * dataset is not visible.
2069 */
2070 if (!INGLOBALZONE(curthread) &&
2071 (!zone_dataset_visible(osname, &canwrite) || !canwrite)) {
2072 error = SET_ERROR(EPERM);
2073 goto out;
2074 }
2075
2076#ifdef SECLABEL
2077 error = zfs_mount_label_policy(vfsp, osname);
2078 if (error)
2079 goto out;
2080#endif
2081
2082#ifdef __FreeBSD_kernel__
2083 vfsp->vfs_flag |= MNT_NFS4ACLS;
2084#endif
2085#ifdef __NetBSD__
2086 vfsp->mnt_iflag |= IMNT_MPSAFE;
2087#endif
2088
2089 /*
2090 * When doing a remount, we simply refresh our temporary properties
2091 * according to those options set in the current VFS options.
2092 */
2093 if (vfsp->vfs_flag & MS_REMOUNT) {
2094 zfsvfs_t *zfsvfs = vfsp->vfs_data;
2095
2096 /*
2097 * Refresh mount options with z_teardown_lock blocking I/O while
2098 * the filesystem is in an inconsistent state.
2099 * The lock also serializes this code with filesystem
2100 * manipulations between entry to zfs_suspend_fs() and return
2101 * from zfs_resume_fs().
2102 */
2103 rrm_enter(&zfsvfs->z_teardown_lock, RW_WRITER, FTAG);
2104 zfs_unregister_callbacks(zfsvfs);
2105 error = zfs_register_callbacks(vfsp);
2106 rrm_exit(&zfsvfs->z_teardown_lock, FTAG);
2107 goto out;
2108 }
2109
2110#ifdef __FreeBSD_kernel__
2111 /* Initial root mount: try hard to import the requested root pool. */
2112 if ((vfsp->vfs_flag & MNT_ROOTFS) != 0 &&
2113 (vfsp->vfs_flag & MNT_UPDATE) == 0) {
2114 char pname[MAXNAMELEN];
2115
2116 error = getpoolname(osname, pname);
2117 if (error == 0)
2118 error = spa_import_rootpool(pname);
2119 if (error)
2120 goto out;
2121 }
2122#endif
2123
2124 DROP_GIANT();
2125 error = zfs_domount(vfsp, osname);
2126 PICKUP_GIANT();
2127
2128#ifdef illumos
2129 /*
2130 * Add an extra VFS_HOLD on our parent vfs so that it can't
2131 * disappear due to a forced unmount.
2132 */
2133 if (error == 0 && ((zfsvfs_t *)vfsp->vfs_data)->z_issnap)
2134 VFS_HOLD(mvp->v_vfsp);
2135#endif
2136
2137#ifdef __NetBSD__
2138 /* setup zfs mount info */
2139 strlcpy(vfsp->mnt_stat.f_mntfromname, osname,
2140 sizeof(vfsp->mnt_stat.f_mntfromname));
2141 set_statvfs_info(path, UIO_USERSPACE, vfsp->mnt_stat.f_mntfromname,
2142 UIO_SYSSPACE, vfsp->mnt_op->vfs_name, vfsp, curlwp);
2143#endif
2144
2145out:
2146 return (error);
2147}
2148
2149#ifdef __FreeBSD_kernel__
2150static int
2151zfs_statfs(vfs_t *vfsp, struct statfs *statp)
2152#endif
2153#ifdef __NetBSD__
2154static int
2155zfs_statvfs(vfs_t *vfsp, struct statvfs *statp)
2156#endif
2157{
2158 zfsvfs_t *zfsvfs = vfsp->vfs_data;
2159 uint64_t refdbytes, availbytes, usedobjs, availobjs;
2160
2161#ifdef __FreeBSD_kernel__
2162 statp->f_version = STATFS_VERSION;
2163#endif
2164
2165 ZFS_ENTER(zfsvfs);
2166
2167 dmu_objset_space(zfsvfs->z_os,
2168 &refdbytes, &availbytes, &usedobjs, &availobjs);
2169
2170 /*
2171 * The underlying storage pool actually uses multiple block sizes.
2172 * We report the fragsize as the smallest block size we support,
2173 * and we report our blocksize as the filesystem's maximum blocksize.
2174 */
2175 statp->f_bsize = SPA_MINBLOCKSIZE;
2176#ifdef __NetBSD__
2177 statp->f_frsize = SPA_MINBLOCKSIZE;
2178#endif
2179 statp->f_iosize = zfsvfs->z_vfs->mnt_stat.f_iosize;
2180
2181 /*
2182 * The following report "total" blocks of various kinds in the
2183 * file system, but reported in terms of f_frsize - the
2184 * "fragment" size.
2185 */
2186
2187 statp->f_blocks = (refdbytes + availbytes) >> SPA_MINBLOCKSHIFT;
2188 statp->f_bfree = availbytes / statp->f_bsize;
2189 statp->f_bavail = statp->f_bfree; /* no root reservation */
2190
2191 /*
2192 * statvfs() should really be called statufs(), because it assumes
2193 * static metadata. ZFS doesn't preallocate files, so the best
2194 * we can do is report the max that could possibly fit in f_files,
2195 * and that minus the number actually used in f_ffree.
2196 * For f_ffree, report the smaller of the number of object available
2197 * and the number of blocks (each object will take at least a block).
2198 */
2199 statp->f_ffree = MIN(availobjs, statp->f_bfree);
2200#ifndef __FreeBSD__
2201 statp->f_favail = statp->f_ffree; /* no "root reservation" */
2202#endif
2203 statp->f_files = statp->f_ffree + usedobjs;
2204
2205#ifdef __FreeBSD__
2206 (void) cmpldev(&d32, vfsp->vfs_dev);
2207 statp->f_fsid = d32;
2208#endif
2209#ifdef __NetBSD__
2210 statp->f_fsid = vfsp->mnt_stat.f_fsid;
2211 statp->f_fsidx = vfsp->mnt_stat.f_fsidx;
2212#endif
2213
2214 /*
2215 * We're a zfs filesystem.
2216 */
2217 (void) strlcpy(statp->f_fstypename, "zfs", sizeof(statp->f_fstypename));
2218
2219 strlcpy(statp->f_mntfromname, vfsp->mnt_stat.f_mntfromname,
2220 sizeof(statp->f_mntfromname));
2221 strlcpy(statp->f_mntonname, vfsp->mnt_stat.f_mntonname,
2222 sizeof(statp->f_mntonname));
2223
2224#ifdef __FreeBSD_kernel__
2225 statp->f_namemax = MAXNAMELEN - 1;
2226#endif
2227#ifdef __NetBSD__
2228 statp->f_namemax = ZFS_MAXNAMELEN;
2229#endif
2230
2231 ZFS_EXIT(zfsvfs);
2232 return (0);
2233}
2234
2235static int
2236zfs_root(vfs_t *vfsp, int flags, vnode_t **vpp)
2237{
2238 zfsvfs_t *zfsvfs = vfsp->vfs_data;
2239 znode_t *rootzp;
2240 int error;
2241
2242 ZFS_ENTER(zfsvfs);
2243
2244 error = zfs_zget(zfsvfs, zfsvfs->z_root, &rootzp);
2245 if (error == 0)
2246 *vpp = ZTOV(rootzp);
2247
2248 ZFS_EXIT(zfsvfs);
2249
2250 if (error == 0) {
2251 error = vn_lock(*vpp, flags);
2252 if (error != 0) {
2253 VN_RELE(*vpp);
2254 *vpp = NULL;
2255 }
2256 }
2257 return (error);
2258}
2259
2260/*
2261 * Teardown the zfsvfs::z_os.
2262 *
2263 * Note, if 'unmounting' if FALSE, we return with the 'z_teardown_lock'
2264 * and 'z_teardown_inactive_lock' held.
2265 */
2266static int
2267zfsvfs_teardown(zfsvfs_t *zfsvfs, boolean_t unmounting)
2268{
2269 znode_t *zp;
2270
2271 rrm_enter(&zfsvfs->z_teardown_lock, RW_WRITER, FTAG);
2272
2273 if (!unmounting) {
2274 /*
2275 * We purge the parent filesystem's vfsp as the parent
2276 * filesystem and all of its snapshots have their vnode's
2277 * v_vfsp set to the parent's filesystem's vfsp. Note,
2278 * 'z_parent' is self referential for non-snapshots.
2279 */
2280 (void) dnlc_purge_vfsp(zfsvfs->z_parent->z_vfs, 0);
2281#ifdef FREEBSD_NAMECACHE
2282 cache_purgevfs(zfsvfs->z_parent->z_vfs, true);
2283#endif
2284 }
2285
2286 /*
2287 * Close the zil. NB: Can't close the zil while zfs_inactive
2288 * threads are blocked as zil_close can call zfs_inactive.
2289 */
2290 if (zfsvfs->z_log) {
2291 zil_close(zfsvfs->z_log);
2292 zfsvfs->z_log = NULL;
2293 }
2294
2295 rw_enter(&zfsvfs->z_teardown_inactive_lock, RW_WRITER);
2296
2297 /*
2298 * If we are not unmounting (ie: online recv) and someone already
2299 * unmounted this file system while we were doing the switcheroo,
2300 * or a reopen of z_os failed then just bail out now.
2301 */
2302 if (!unmounting && (zfsvfs->z_unmounted || zfsvfs->z_os == NULL)) {
2303 rw_exit(&zfsvfs->z_teardown_inactive_lock);
2304 rrm_exit(&zfsvfs->z_teardown_lock, FTAG);
2305 return (SET_ERROR(EIO));
2306 }
2307
2308 /*
2309 * At this point there are no vops active, and any new vops will
2310 * fail with EIO since we have z_teardown_lock for writer (only
2311 * relavent for forced unmount).
2312 *
2313 * Release all holds on dbufs.
2314 */
2315 mutex_enter(&zfsvfs->z_znodes_lock);
2316 for (zp = list_head(&zfsvfs->z_all_znodes); zp != NULL;
2317 zp = list_next(&zfsvfs->z_all_znodes, zp))
2318 if (zp->z_sa_hdl) {
2319 ASSERT(ZTOV(zp)->v_count >= 0);
2320 zfs_znode_dmu_fini(zp);
2321 }
2322 mutex_exit(&zfsvfs->z_znodes_lock);
2323
2324 /*
2325 * If we are unmounting, set the unmounted flag and let new vops
2326 * unblock. zfs_inactive will have the unmounted behavior, and all
2327 * other vops will fail with EIO.
2328 */
2329 if (unmounting) {
2330 zfsvfs->z_unmounted = B_TRUE;
2331 rrm_exit(&zfsvfs->z_teardown_lock, FTAG);
2332 rw_exit(&zfsvfs->z_teardown_inactive_lock);
2333 }
2334
2335 /*
2336 * z_os will be NULL if there was an error in attempting to reopen
2337 * zfsvfs, so just return as the properties had already been
2338 * unregistered and cached data had been evicted before.
2339 */
2340 if (zfsvfs->z_os == NULL)
2341 return (0);
2342
2343 /*
2344 * Unregister properties.
2345 */
2346 zfs_unregister_callbacks(zfsvfs);
2347
2348 /*
2349 * Evict cached data
2350 */
2351 if (dsl_dataset_is_dirty(dmu_objset_ds(zfsvfs->z_os)) &&
2352 !(zfsvfs->z_vfs->vfs_flag & VFS_RDONLY))
2353 txg_wait_synced(dmu_objset_pool(zfsvfs->z_os), 0);
2354 dmu_objset_evict_dbufs(zfsvfs->z_os);
2355
2356 return (0);
2357}
2358
2359/*ARGSUSED*/
2360static int
2361zfs_umount(vfs_t *vfsp, int fflag)
2362{
2363 zfsvfs_t *zfsvfs = vfsp->vfs_data;
2364 objset_t *os;
2365 int ret;
2366#ifdef __FreeBSD_kernel__
2367 kthread_t *td = curthread;
2368 cred_t *cr = td->td_ucred;
2369#endif
2370#ifdef __NetBSD__
2371 cred_t *cr = CRED();
2372#endif
2373
2374 ret = secpolicy_fs_unmount(cr, vfsp);
2375 if (ret) {
2376 if (dsl_deleg_access((char *)refstr_value(vfsp->vfs_resource),
2377 ZFS_DELEG_PERM_MOUNT, cr))
2378 return (ret);
2379 }
2380
2381 /*
2382 * We purge the parent filesystem's vfsp as the parent filesystem
2383 * and all of its snapshots have their vnode's v_vfsp set to the
2384 * parent's filesystem's vfsp. Note, 'z_parent' is self
2385 * referential for non-snapshots.
2386 */
2387 (void) dnlc_purge_vfsp(zfsvfs->z_parent->z_vfs, 0);
2388
2389 /*
2390 * Unmount any snapshots mounted under .zfs before unmounting the
2391 * dataset itself.
2392 */
2393 if (zfsvfs->z_ctldir != NULL) {
2394 if ((ret = zfsctl_umount_snapshots(vfsp, fflag, cr)) != 0)
2395 return (ret);
2396 }
2397
2398 if (fflag & MS_FORCE) {
2399 /*
2400 * Mark file system as unmounted before calling
2401 * vflush(FORCECLOSE). This way we ensure no future vnops
2402 * will be called and risk operating on DOOMED vnodes.
2403 */
2404 rrm_enter(&zfsvfs->z_teardown_lock, RW_WRITER, FTAG);
2405 zfsvfs->z_unmounted = B_TRUE;
2406 rrm_exit(&zfsvfs->z_teardown_lock, FTAG);
2407 }
2408
2409 /*
2410 * Flush all the files.
2411 */
2412#ifdef __FreeBSD_kernel__
2413 ret = vflush(vfsp, 0, (fflag & MS_FORCE) ? FORCECLOSE : 0, td);
2414#endif
2415#ifdef __NetBSD__
2416 ret = vflush(vfsp, NULL, (fflag & MS_FORCE) ? FORCECLOSE : 0);
2417#endif
2418 if (ret != 0)
2419 return (ret);
2420
2421#ifdef illumos
2422 if (!(fflag & MS_FORCE)) {
2423 /*
2424 * Check the number of active vnodes in the file system.
2425 * Our count is maintained in the vfs structure, but the
2426 * number is off by 1 to indicate a hold on the vfs
2427 * structure itself.
2428 *
2429 * The '.zfs' directory maintains a reference of its
2430 * own, and any active references underneath are
2431 * reflected in the vnode count.
2432 */
2433 if (zfsvfs->z_ctldir == NULL) {
2434 if (vfsp->vfs_count > 1)
2435 return (SET_ERROR(EBUSY));
2436 } else {
2437 if (vfsp->vfs_count > 2 ||
2438 zfsvfs->z_ctldir->v_count > 1)
2439 return (SET_ERROR(EBUSY));
2440 }
2441 }
2442#endif
2443
2444 VERIFY(zfsvfs_teardown(zfsvfs, B_TRUE) == 0);
2445 os = zfsvfs->z_os;
2446
2447 /*
2448 * z_os will be NULL if there was an error in
2449 * attempting to reopen zfsvfs.
2450 */
2451 if (os != NULL) {
2452 /*
2453 * Unset the objset user_ptr.
2454 */
2455 mutex_enter(&os->os_user_ptr_lock);
2456 dmu_objset_set_user(os, NULL);
2457 mutex_exit(&os->os_user_ptr_lock);
2458
2459 /*
2460 * Finally release the objset
2461 */
2462 dmu_objset_disown(os, zfsvfs);
2463 }
2464
2465 /*
2466 * We can now safely destroy the '.zfs' directory node.
2467 */
2468 if (zfsvfs->z_ctldir != NULL)
2469 zfsctl_destroy(zfsvfs);
2470 zfs_freevfs(vfsp);
2471
2472 return (0);
2473}
2474
2475#ifdef __FreeBSD_kernel__
2476static int
2477zfs_vget(vfs_t *vfsp, ino_t ino, int flags, vnode_t **vpp)
2478#endif
2479#ifdef __NetBSD__
2480static int
2481zfs_vget(vfs_t *vfsp, ino_t ino, vnode_t **vpp)
2482#endif
2483{
2484 zfsvfs_t *zfsvfs = vfsp->vfs_data;
2485 znode_t *zp;
2486 int err;
2487#ifdef __NetBSD__
2488 int flags = LK_EXCLUSIVE;
2489#endif
2490
2491 /*
2492 * zfs_zget() can't operate on virtual entries like .zfs/ or
2493 * .zfs/snapshot/ directories, that's why we return EOPNOTSUPP.
2494 * This will make NFS to switch to LOOKUP instead of using VGET.
2495 */
2496 if (ino == ZFSCTL_INO_ROOT || ino == ZFSCTL_INO_SNAPDIR ||
2497 (zfsvfs->z_shares_dir != 0 && ino == zfsvfs->z_shares_dir))
2498 return (EOPNOTSUPP);
2499
2500 ZFS_ENTER(zfsvfs);
2501 err = zfs_zget(zfsvfs, ino, &zp);
2502 if (err == 0 && zp->z_unlinked) {
2503 VN_RELE(ZTOV(zp));
2504 err = EINVAL;
2505 }
2506 if (err == 0)
2507 *vpp = ZTOV(zp);
2508 ZFS_EXIT(zfsvfs);
2509 if (err == 0)
2510 err = vn_lock(*vpp, flags);
2511 if (err != 0)
2512 *vpp = NULL;
2513
2514 return (err);
2515}
2516
2517#ifdef __FreeBSD_kernel__
2518static int
2519zfs_checkexp(vfs_t *vfsp, struct sockaddr *nam, int *extflagsp,
2520 struct ucred **credanonp, int *numsecflavors, int **secflavors)
2521{
2522 zfsvfs_t *zfsvfs = vfsp->vfs_data;
2523
2524 /*
2525 * If this is regular file system vfsp is the same as
2526 * zfsvfs->z_parent->z_vfs, but if it is snapshot,
2527 * zfsvfs->z_parent->z_vfs represents parent file system
2528 * which we have to use here, because only this file system
2529 * has mnt_export configured.
2530 */
2531 return (vfs_stdcheckexp(zfsvfs->z_parent->z_vfs, nam, extflagsp,
2532 credanonp, numsecflavors, secflavors));
2533}
2534
2535CTASSERT(SHORT_FID_LEN <= sizeof(struct fid));
2536CTASSERT(LONG_FID_LEN <= sizeof(struct fid));
2537#endif
2538
2539#ifdef __FreeBSD_kernel__
2540static int
2541zfs_fhtovp(vfs_t *vfsp, fid_t *fidp, int flags, vnode_t **vpp)
2542{
2543 struct componentname cn;
2544 zfsvfs_t *zfsvfs = vfsp->vfs_data;
2545 znode_t *zp;
2546 vnode_t *dvp;
2547 uint64_t object = 0;
2548 uint64_t fid_gen = 0;
2549 uint64_t gen_mask;
2550 uint64_t zp_gen;
2551 int i, err;
2552
2553 *vpp = NULL;
2554
2555 ZFS_ENTER(zfsvfs);
2556
2557 /*
2558 * On FreeBSD we can get snapshot's mount point or its parent file
2559 * system mount point depending if snapshot is already mounted or not.
2560 */
2561 if (zfsvfs->z_parent == zfsvfs && fidp->fid_len == LONG_FID_LEN) {
2562 zfid_long_t *zlfid = (zfid_long_t *)fidp;
2563 uint64_t objsetid = 0;
2564 uint64_t setgen = 0;
2565
2566 for (i = 0; i < sizeof (zlfid->zf_setid); i++)
2567 objsetid |= ((uint64_t)zlfid->zf_setid[i]) << (8 * i);
2568
2569 for (i = 0; i < sizeof (zlfid->zf_setgen); i++)
2570 setgen |= ((uint64_t)zlfid->zf_setgen[i]) << (8 * i);
2571
2572 ZFS_EXIT(zfsvfs);
2573
2574 err = zfsctl_lookup_objset(vfsp, objsetid, &zfsvfs);
2575 if (err)
2576 return (SET_ERROR(EINVAL));
2577 ZFS_ENTER(zfsvfs);
2578 }
2579
2580 if (fidp->fid_len == SHORT_FID_LEN || fidp->fid_len == LONG_FID_LEN) {
2581 zfid_short_t *zfid = (zfid_short_t *)fidp;
2582
2583 for (i = 0; i < sizeof (zfid->zf_object); i++)
2584 object |= ((uint64_t)zfid->zf_object[i]) << (8 * i);
2585
2586 for (i = 0; i < sizeof (zfid->zf_gen); i++)
2587 fid_gen |= ((uint64_t)zfid->zf_gen[i]) << (8 * i);
2588 } else {
2589 ZFS_EXIT(zfsvfs);
2590 return (SET_ERROR(EINVAL));
2591 }
2592
2593 /*
2594 * A zero fid_gen means we are in .zfs or the .zfs/snapshot
2595 * directory tree. If the object == zfsvfs->z_shares_dir, then
2596 * we are in the .zfs/shares directory tree.
2597 */
2598 if ((fid_gen == 0 &&
2599 (object == ZFSCTL_INO_ROOT || object == ZFSCTL_INO_SNAPDIR)) ||
2600 (zfsvfs->z_shares_dir != 0 && object == zfsvfs->z_shares_dir)) {
2601 ZFS_EXIT(zfsvfs);
2602 VERIFY0(zfsctl_root(zfsvfs, LK_SHARED, &dvp));
2603 if (object == ZFSCTL_INO_SNAPDIR) {
2604 cn.cn_nameptr = "snapshot";
2605 cn.cn_namelen = strlen(cn.cn_nameptr);
2606 cn.cn_nameiop = LOOKUP;
2607 cn.cn_flags = ISLASTCN | LOCKLEAF;
2608 cn.cn_lkflags = flags;
2609 VERIFY0(VOP_LOOKUP(dvp, vpp, &cn));
2610 vput(dvp);
2611 } else if (object == zfsvfs->z_shares_dir) {
2612 /*
2613 * XXX This branch must not be taken,
2614 * if it is, then the lookup below will
2615 * explode.
2616 */
2617 cn.cn_nameptr = "shares";
2618 cn.cn_namelen = strlen(cn.cn_nameptr);
2619 cn.cn_nameiop = LOOKUP;
2620 cn.cn_flags = ISLASTCN;
2621 cn.cn_lkflags = flags;
2622 VERIFY0(VOP_LOOKUP(dvp, vpp, &cn));
2623 vput(dvp);
2624 } else {
2625 *vpp = dvp;
2626 }
2627 return (err);
2628 }
2629
2630 gen_mask = -1ULL >> (64 - 8 * i);
2631
2632 dprintf("getting %llu [%u mask %llx]\n", object, fid_gen, gen_mask);
2633 if (err = zfs_zget(zfsvfs, object, &zp)) {
2634 ZFS_EXIT(zfsvfs);
2635 return (err);
2636 }
2637 (void) sa_lookup(zp->z_sa_hdl, SA_ZPL_GEN(zfsvfs), &zp_gen,
2638 sizeof (uint64_t));
2639 zp_gen = zp_gen & gen_mask;
2640 if (zp_gen == 0)
2641 zp_gen = 1;
2642 if (zp->z_unlinked || zp_gen != fid_gen) {
2643 dprintf("znode gen (%u) != fid gen (%u)\n", zp_gen, fid_gen);
2644 VN_RELE(ZTOV(zp));
2645 ZFS_EXIT(zfsvfs);
2646 return (SET_ERROR(EINVAL));
2647 }
2648
2649 *vpp = ZTOV(zp);
2650 ZFS_EXIT(zfsvfs);
2651 err = vn_lock(*vpp, flags);
2652 if (err == 0)
2653 vnode_create_vobject(*vpp, zp->z_size, curthread);
2654 else
2655 *vpp = NULL;
2656 return (err);
2657}
2658#endif /* __FreeBSD_kernel__ */
2659
2660/*
2661 * Block out VOPs and close zfsvfs_t::z_os
2662 *
2663 * Note, if successful, then we return with the 'z_teardown_lock' and
2664 * 'z_teardown_inactive_lock' write held. We leave ownership of the underlying
2665 * dataset and objset intact so that they can be atomically handed off during
2666 * a subsequent rollback or recv operation and the resume thereafter.
2667 */
2668int
2669zfs_suspend_fs(zfsvfs_t *zfsvfs)
2670{
2671 int error;
2672
2673#ifdef __NetBSD__
2674 if ((error = vfs_suspend(zfsvfs->z_vfs, 0)) != 0)
2675 return error;
2676 if ((error = zfsvfs_teardown(zfsvfs, B_FALSE)) != 0) {
2677 vfs_resume(zfsvfs->z_vfs);
2678 return (error);
2679 }
2680#else
2681 if ((error = zfsvfs_teardown(zfsvfs, B_FALSE)) != 0)
2682 return (error);
2683#endif
2684
2685 return (0);
2686}
2687
2688/*
2689 * Rebuild SA and release VOPs. Note that ownership of the underlying dataset
2690 * is an invariant across any of the operations that can be performed while the
2691 * filesystem was suspended. Whether it succeeded or failed, the preconditions
2692 * are the same: the relevant objset and associated dataset are owned by
2693 * zfsvfs, held, and long held on entry.
2694 */
2695#ifdef __NetBSD__
2696static bool
2697zfs_resume_selector(void *cl, struct vnode *vp)
2698{
2699
2700 if (zfsctl_is_node(vp))
2701 return false;
2702 return (VTOZ(vp)->z_sa_hdl == NULL);
2703}
2704#endif
2705int
2706zfs_resume_fs(zfsvfs_t *zfsvfs, dsl_dataset_t *ds)
2707{
2708 int err;
2709 znode_t *zp;
2710
2711 ASSERT(RRM_WRITE_HELD(&zfsvfs->z_teardown_lock));
2712 ASSERT(RW_WRITE_HELD(&zfsvfs->z_teardown_inactive_lock));
2713
2714 /*
2715 * We already own this, so just update the objset_t, as the one we
2716 * had before may have been evicted.
2717 */
2718 objset_t *os;
2719 VERIFY3P(ds->ds_owner, ==, zfsvfs);
2720 VERIFY(dsl_dataset_long_held(ds));
2721 VERIFY0(dmu_objset_from_ds(ds, &os));
2722
2723 err = zfsvfs_init(zfsvfs, os);
2724 if (err != 0)
2725 goto bail;
2726
2727 VERIFY(zfsvfs_setup(zfsvfs, B_FALSE) == 0);
2728
2729 zfs_set_fuid_feature(zfsvfs);
2730
2731 /*
2732 * Attempt to re-establish all the active znodes with
2733 * their dbufs. If a zfs_rezget() fails, then we'll let
2734 * any potential callers discover that via ZFS_ENTER_VERIFY_VP
2735 * when they try to use their znode.
2736 */
2737 mutex_enter(&zfsvfs->z_znodes_lock);
2738 for (zp = list_head(&zfsvfs->z_all_znodes); zp;
2739 zp = list_next(&zfsvfs->z_all_znodes, zp)) {
2740 (void) zfs_rezget(zp);
2741 }
2742 mutex_exit(&zfsvfs->z_znodes_lock);
2743
2744bail:
2745 /* release the VOPs */
2746 rw_exit(&zfsvfs->z_teardown_inactive_lock);
2747 rrm_exit(&zfsvfs->z_teardown_lock, FTAG);
2748#ifdef __NetBSD__
2749 struct vnode_iterator *marker;
2750 vnode_t *vp;
2751
2752 vfs_vnode_iterator_init(zfsvfs->z_vfs, &marker);
2753 while ((vp = vfs_vnode_iterator_next(marker,
2754 zfs_resume_selector, NULL))) {
2755 vgone(vp);
2756 }
2757 vfs_vnode_iterator_destroy(marker);
2758 vfs_resume(zfsvfs->z_vfs);
2759#endif
2760
2761 if (err) {
2762 /*
2763 * Since we couldn't setup the sa framework, try to force
2764 * unmount this file system.
2765 */
2766 if (vn_vfswlock(zfsvfs->z_vfs->vfs_vnodecovered) == 0) {
2767 vfs_ref(zfsvfs->z_vfs);
2768 (void) dounmount(zfsvfs->z_vfs, MS_FORCE, curthread);
2769 }
2770 }
2771 return (err);
2772}
2773
2774static void
2775zfs_freevfs(vfs_t *vfsp)
2776{
2777 zfsvfs_t *zfsvfs = vfsp->vfs_data;
2778
2779#ifdef illumos
2780 /*
2781 * If this is a snapshot, we have an extra VFS_HOLD on our parent
2782 * from zfs_mount(). Release it here. If we came through
2783 * zfs_mountroot() instead, we didn't grab an extra hold, so
2784 * skip the VFS_RELE for rootvfs.
2785 */
2786 if (zfsvfs->z_issnap && (vfsp != rootvfs))
2787 VFS_RELE(zfsvfs->z_parent->z_vfs);
2788#endif
2789
2790 zfsvfs_free(zfsvfs);
2791
2792 atomic_dec_32(&zfs_active_fs_count);
2793}
2794
2795#ifdef __FreeBSD_kernel__
2796#ifdef __i386__
2797static int desiredvnodes_backup;
2798#endif
2799
2800static void
2801zfs_vnodes_adjust(void)
2802{
2803#ifdef __i386__
2804 int newdesiredvnodes;
2805
2806 desiredvnodes_backup = desiredvnodes;
2807
2808 /*
2809 * We calculate newdesiredvnodes the same way it is done in
2810 * vntblinit(). If it is equal to desiredvnodes, it means that
2811 * it wasn't tuned by the administrator and we can tune it down.
2812 */
2813 newdesiredvnodes = min(maxproc + vm_cnt.v_page_count / 4, 2 *
2814 vm_kmem_size / (5 * (sizeof(struct vm_object) +
2815 sizeof(struct vnode))));
2816 if (newdesiredvnodes == desiredvnodes)
2817 desiredvnodes = (3 * newdesiredvnodes) / 4;
2818#endif
2819}
2820
2821static void
2822zfs_vnodes_adjust_back(void)
2823{
2824
2825#ifdef __i386__
2826 desiredvnodes = desiredvnodes_backup;
2827#endif
2828}
2829#endif /* __FreeBSD_kernel__ */
2830
2831#ifdef __NetBSD__
2832static void
2833zfs_vnodes_adjust(void)
2834{
2835}
2836
2837static void
2838zfs_vnodes_adjust_back(void)
2839{
2840}
2841#endif
2842
2843void
2844zfs_init(void)
2845{
2846
2847 printf("ZFS filesystem version: " ZPL_VERSION_STRING "\n");
2848
2849 /*
2850 * Initialize .zfs directory structures
2851 */
2852 zfsctl_init();
2853
2854 /*
2855 * Initialize znode cache, vnode ops, etc...
2856 */
2857 zfs_znode_init();
2858
2859 /*
2860 * Reduce number of vnodes. Originally number of vnodes is calculated
2861 * with UFS inode in mind. We reduce it here, because it's too big for
2862 * ZFS/i386.
2863 */
2864 zfs_vnodes_adjust();
2865
2866 dmu_objset_register_type(DMU_OST_ZFS, zfs_space_delta_cb);
2867}
2868
2869void
2870zfs_fini(void)
2871{
2872 zfsctl_fini();
2873 zfs_znode_fini();
2874 zfs_vnodes_adjust_back();
2875}
2876
2877int
2878zfs_busy(void)
2879{
2880 return (zfs_active_fs_count != 0);
2881}
2882
2883int
2884zfs_set_version(zfsvfs_t *zfsvfs, uint64_t newvers)
2885{
2886 int error;
2887 objset_t *os = zfsvfs->z_os;
2888 dmu_tx_t *tx;
2889
2890 if (newvers < ZPL_VERSION_INITIAL || newvers > ZPL_VERSION)
2891 return (SET_ERROR(EINVAL));
2892
2893 if (newvers < zfsvfs->z_version)
2894 return (SET_ERROR(EINVAL));
2895
2896 if (zfs_spa_version_map(newvers) >
2897 spa_version(dmu_objset_spa(zfsvfs->z_os)))
2898 return (SET_ERROR(ENOTSUP));
2899
2900 tx = dmu_tx_create(os);
2901 dmu_tx_hold_zap(tx, MASTER_NODE_OBJ, B_FALSE, ZPL_VERSION_STR);
2902 if (newvers >= ZPL_VERSION_SA && !zfsvfs->z_use_sa) {
2903 dmu_tx_hold_zap(tx, MASTER_NODE_OBJ, B_TRUE,
2904 ZFS_SA_ATTRS);
2905 dmu_tx_hold_zap(tx, DMU_NEW_OBJECT, FALSE, NULL);
2906 }
2907 error = dmu_tx_assign(tx, TXG_WAIT);
2908 if (error) {
2909 dmu_tx_abort(tx);
2910 return (error);
2911 }
2912
2913 error = zap_update(os, MASTER_NODE_OBJ, ZPL_VERSION_STR,
2914 8, 1, &newvers, tx);
2915
2916 if (error) {
2917 dmu_tx_commit(tx);
2918 return (error);
2919 }
2920
2921 if (newvers >= ZPL_VERSION_SA && !zfsvfs->z_use_sa) {
2922 uint64_t sa_obj;
2923
2924 ASSERT3U(spa_version(dmu_objset_spa(zfsvfs->z_os)), >=,
2925 SPA_VERSION_SA);
2926 sa_obj = zap_create(os, DMU_OT_SA_MASTER_NODE,
2927 DMU_OT_NONE, 0, tx);
2928
2929 error = zap_add(os, MASTER_NODE_OBJ,
2930 ZFS_SA_ATTRS, 8, 1, &sa_obj, tx);
2931 ASSERT0(error);
2932
2933 VERIFY(0 == sa_set_sa_object(os, sa_obj));
2934 sa_register_update_callback(os, zfs_sa_upgrade);
2935 }
2936
2937 spa_history_log_internal_ds(dmu_objset_ds(os), "upgrade", tx,
2938 "from %llu to %llu", zfsvfs->z_version, newvers);
2939
2940 dmu_tx_commit(tx);
2941
2942 zfsvfs->z_version = newvers;
2943
2944 zfs_set_fuid_feature(zfsvfs);
2945
2946 return (0);
2947}
2948
2949/*
2950 * Read a property stored within the master node.
2951 */
2952int
2953zfs_get_zplprop(objset_t *os, zfs_prop_t prop, uint64_t *value)
2954{
2955 const char *pname;
2956 int error = ENOENT;
2957
2958 /*
2959 * Look up the file system's value for the property. For the
2960 * version property, we look up a slightly different string.
2961 */
2962 if (prop == ZFS_PROP_VERSION)
2963 pname = ZPL_VERSION_STR;
2964 else
2965 pname = zfs_prop_to_name(prop);
2966
2967 if (os != NULL)
2968 error = zap_lookup(os, MASTER_NODE_OBJ, pname, 8, 1, value);
2969
2970 if (error == ENOENT) {
2971 /* No value set, use the default value */
2972 switch (prop) {
2973 case ZFS_PROP_VERSION:
2974 *value = ZPL_VERSION;
2975 break;
2976 case ZFS_PROP_NORMALIZE:
2977 case ZFS_PROP_UTF8ONLY:
2978 *value = 0;
2979 break;
2980 case ZFS_PROP_CASE:
2981 *value = ZFS_CASE_SENSITIVE;
2982 break;
2983 default:
2984 return (error);
2985 }
2986 error = 0;
2987 }
2988 return (error);
2989}
2990
2991#if defined(__FreeBSD_kernel__) || defined(__NetBSD__)
2992#ifdef _KERNEL
2993void
2994zfsvfs_update_fromname(const char *oldname, const char *newname)
2995{
2996 char tmpbuf[MAXPATHLEN];
2997 struct mount *mp;
2998 char *fromname;
2999 size_t oldlen;
3000
3001 oldlen = strlen(oldname);
3002
3003#ifdef __NetBSD__
3004 mount_iterator_t *iter;
3005 mountlist_iterator_init(&iter);
3006 while ((mp = mountlist_iterator_next(iter)) != NULL) {
3007#else
3008 mtx_lock(&mountlist_mtx);
3009 TAILQ_FOREACH(mp, &mountlist, mnt_list) {
3010#endif
3011 fromname = mp->mnt_stat.f_mntfromname;
3012 if (strcmp(fromname, oldname) == 0) {
3013 (void)strlcpy(fromname, newname,
3014 sizeof(mp->mnt_stat.f_mntfromname));
3015 continue;
3016 }
3017 if (strncmp(fromname, oldname, oldlen) == 0 &&
3018 (fromname[oldlen] == '/' || fromname[oldlen] == '@')) {
3019 (void)snprintf(tmpbuf, sizeof(tmpbuf), "%s%s",
3020 newname, fromname + oldlen);
3021 (void)strlcpy(fromname, tmpbuf,
3022 sizeof(mp->mnt_stat.f_mntfromname));
3023 continue;
3024 }
3025 }
3026#ifdef __NetBSD__
3027 mountlist_iterator_destroy(iter);
3028#else
3029 mtx_unlock(&mountlist_mtx);
3030#endif
3031}
3032#endif
3033#endif
